<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;FONT-STYLE:ITALIC;COLOR:#000000;FONT-SIZE:11PT;">
	When we use the terms &#x201C;Ur-Energy,&#x201D; &#x201C;we,&#x201D; &#x201C;us,&#x201D; &#x201C;our,&#x201D;
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;FONT-STYLE:ITALIC;COLOR:#000000;FONT-SIZE:11PT;">
	or the &#x201C;Company&#x201D;

<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;FONT-STYLE:ITALIC;COLOR:#000000;FONT-SIZE:11PT;">
	we are referring to Ur-Energy Inc. and its subsidiaries, unless the context otherwise requires. We have included technical terms important to an understanding of our business under &#x201C;Glossary of Common Terms&#x201D; at the end of this section. Throughout this document we make statements that are classified as &#x201C;forward-looking.&#x201D; Please refer to the &#x201C;Cautionary Statement Regarding Forward-Looking Statements&#x201D; section of this document for an explanation of these types of assertions.
</FONT>

<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;TEXT-JUSTIFY:INTER-IDEOGRAPH;FONT-WEIGHT:BOLD;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN,TIMES,SERIF;FONT-SIZE: 11PT;">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;FONT-STYLE:ITALIC;COLOR:#000000;">
	Cautionary Statement Regarding
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;FONT-STYLE:ITALIC;">
	Forward-Looking Information
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;TEXT-JUSTIFY:INTER-IDEOGRAPH;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN,TIMES,SERIF;FONT-SIZE: 11PT;">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;TEXT-JUSTIFY:INTER-IDEOGRAPH;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN,TIMES,SERIF;FONT-SIZE: 11PT;">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	This annual report on Form 10-K contains "forward-looking statements" within the meaning of applicable United States and Canadian securities laws, and these forward-looking statements can be identified by the use of words
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	such as "expect", "anticipate", "estimate", "believe", "may", "potential", "intends", "plans" and other similar expressions or statements that an action, event or result "may", "could" or "should" be taken, occur or be achieved, or the negative thereof or other similar statements. These statements are only predictions and involve known and unknown risks, uncertainties and other factors which may cause our actual results, performance or achievements, or industry results, to be materially different from any future results, performance, or achievements expressed or implied by these forward-looking statements. Such statements include, but are not limited to: (i) the ability to maintain steady state operations at Lost Creek and
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	timing to
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	ramp up to production rates at design capacity; (ii) the technical and economic viability of Lost Creek; (iii) the timing and outcome of permitting and regulatory approvals of the amendment for LC E
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	ast and the KM horizon; (iv) the
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	ability to complete additional favorable uranium sales agreements including spot sales if production is available and the market warrants; (v) the production rates and life of the Lost Creek Project and subsequent production from adjoining properties, including LC East; (vi) the potential of exploration targets throughout the Lost Creek Property (including the ability to expand resources); (vii) the potential of our other exploration and development projects, including Shirley Basin, as well as the technical and economic viability of Shirley Basin; (viii) the timing and outcome of applications for regulatory approval to build and operate an ISR mine at Shirley Basin; (ix) the outcome of our forecasts and production projections; and (x) the continuing and long-term effects on the uranium market of events in Japan in 2011 including supply and demand projections.&nbsp;These other factors include, among others, the following:
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	future estimates for production, production ramp-up and operations (including any difficulties with continued ramp up),&nbsp;capital expenditures, operating costs, mineral resources, recovery rates, grades and
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	market
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	prices; business strategies and measures to implement such strategies; competitive strengths; estimates of goals for expansion and growth of the business and operations; plans and references to our future successes; our
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	history of operating losses and uncertainty of future profitability; status as an exploration stage company; the lack of mineral reserves; risks associated with obtaining permits
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	and other authorizations
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	in the United States; risks associated with current variable economic conditions; our ability to service our debt and maintain compliance with all restrictive covenants related to the debt facilities and security documents; the possible impact of future financings; the hazards associated with mining production; compliance with environmental laws and regulations; uncertainty regarding the pricing and collection of accounts; the possibility for adverse results in potential litigation; uncertainties associated with changes in government policy and regulation; uncertainties associated with a Canada Revenue Agency or U.S. Internal Revenue Service audit of any of our cross border transactions; adverse changes in general business conditions in any of the countries in which we do business; changes in size and structure; the effectiveness of management and our strategic relationships; ability to attract and retain key personnel; uncertainties regarding the need for additional capital; uncertainty regarding the fluctuations of quarterly results; foreign currency exchange risks; ability to enforce civil liabilities under U.S. securities laws outside the United States; ability to maintain our listing on the NYSE MKT LLC (&#x201C;NYSE MKT&#x201D;) and Toronto Stock Exchange (&#x201C;TSX&#x201D;); risks associated with the expected classification as a "passive foreign investment company
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	" under the applicable provisions of the U.S. Internal Revenue Code of 1986, as amended; risks associated with our investments and other risks and uncertainties described under the heading &#x201C;Risk Factors&#x201D; of this annual report.
</FONT>
</P>

<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;TEXT-JUSTIFY:INTER-IDEOGRAPH;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN,TIMES,SERIF;FONT-SIZE: 11PT;">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	&nbsp;

<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;TEXT-JUSTIFY:INTER-IDEOGRAPH;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN,TIMES,SERIF;FONT-SIZE: 11PT;">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;FONT-WEIGHT:BOLD;FONT-STYLE:ITALIC;">
	Cautionary Note to U.S. Investors Concerning Disclosure of Mineral Resources
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;TEXT-JUSTIFY:INTER-IDEOGRAPH;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN,TIMES,SERIF;FONT-SIZE: 11PT;">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;TEXT-JUSTIFY:INTER-IDEOGRAPH;BORDER-BOTTOM:1PT NONE #D9D9D9 ;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN,TIMES,SERIF;FONT-SIZE: 11PT;">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	Unless otherwise indicated, all resource estimates included in this Form 10-K have been prepared in accordance with Canadian National Instrument 43-101
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;FONT-STYLE:ITALIC;">
	Standards of Disclosure for Mineral Projects
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	(&#x201C;NI 43-101&#x201D;) and the Canadian Institute of Mining, Metallurgy and Petroleum Definition Standards for Mineral Resources and Mineral Reserves (&#x201C;CIM Definition Standards&#x201D;). NI 43-101 is a rule developed by the Canadian Securities Administrators which establishes standards for all public disclosure an issuer makes of scientific and technical information concerning mineral projects. NI 43-101 permits the disclosure of an historical estimate made prior to the adoption of NI 43-101 that does not comply with NI 43-101 to be disclosed using the historical terminology if the disclosure: (a) identifies the source and date of the historical estimate; (b) comments on the relevance and reliability of the historical estimate; (c) to the extent known, provides the key assumptions, parameters and methods used to prepare the historical estimate; (d) states whether the historical estimate uses categories other than those prescribed by NI 43-101; and (e) includes any more recent estimates or data available.
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;FONT-WEIGHT:BOLD;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;TEXT-JUSTIFY:INTER-IDEOGRAPH;BORDER-TOP:1PT NONE #D9D9D9 ;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN,TIMES,SERIF;FONT-SIZE: 11PT;">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;TEXT-JUSTIFY:INTER-IDEOGRAPH;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN,TIMES,SERIF;FONT-SIZE: 11PT;">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	Canadian standards, including NI 43-101, differ significantly from the requirements of the
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	United States Securities and Exchange Commission (&#x201C;
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	SEC
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	&#x201D;)
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	, and resource information contained in this Form 10-K may not be comparable to similar information disclosed by U.S. companies. In particular, the term &#x201C;resource&#x201D; does not equate to the term &#x201C;&#x2018;reserves&#x201D;. Under SEC Industry Guide 7, mineralization may not be classified as a &#x201C;reserve&#x201D; unless the determination has been made that the mineralization could be economically and legally produced or extracted at the time the reserve determination is made. SEC Industry Guide 7 does not define and the SEC&#x2019;s disclosure standards normally do not permit the inclusion of information concerning &#x201C;measured mineral resources&#x201D;, &#x201C;indicated mineral resources&#x201D; or &#x201C;inferred mineral resources&#x201D; or other descriptions of the amount of mineralization in mineral deposits that do not constitute &#x201C;reserves&#x201D; by U.S. standards in documents filed with the SEC. U.S. investors should also understand that &#x201C;inferred mineral resources&#x201D; have a great amount of uncertainty as to their existence and great uncertainty as to their economic and legal feasibility. It cannot be assumed that all or any part of an &#x201C;inferred mineral resource&#x201D; will ever be upgraded to a higher category. Under Canadian rules, estimated &#x201C;inferred mineral resources&#x201D; may not form the basis of feasibility or pre-feasibility studies except in rare cases. Investors are cautioned not to assume that all or any part of an &#x201C;inferred mineral resource&#x201D; exists or is economically or legally mineable. Disclosure of &#x201C;contained ounces&#x201D; in a resource is permitted disclosure under Canadian regulations; however, the SEC normally only permits issuers to report mineralization that does not constitute &#x201C;reserves&#x201D; by SEC standards as in-place tonnage and grade without reference to unit measures. Accordingly, information concerning mineral deposits set forth herein may not be comparable to information made public by
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	companies that report in accordance with United States standards.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;TEXT-JUSTIFY:INTER-IDEOGRAPH;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN,TIMES,SERIF;FONT-SIZE: 11PT;">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;TEXT-JUSTIFY:INTER-IDEOGRAPH;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN,TIMES,SERIF;FONT-SIZE: 11PT;">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;FONT-WEIGHT:BOLD;">
	NI 43-101 Review of Technical Information:
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	J
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	ames A. Bonner,
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	Ur-Energy
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	Vice President Geology,
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	P.Geo. and SME Registered Member, and Qualified Person as defined by National Instrument 43-101, reviewed and approved the technical information contained in this Annual
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	Report
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;TEXT-JUSTIFY:INTER-IDEOGRAPH;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN,TIMES,SERIF;FONT-SIZE: 11PT;">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT;TEXT-ALIGN:CENTER;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN,TIMES,SERIF;FONT-SIZE: 11PT;">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;FONT-WEIGHT:BOLD;FONT-STYLE:ITALIC;">
</FONT>
</P>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-LEFT:10.2941176470588%;MARGIN-RIGHT:10.2941176470588%;">
<P>
<FONT SIZE="1">
</FONT>
</P>
<DIV STYLE="WIDTH:100%">
<P STYLE="MARGIN:24PT 0PT 0PT;TEXT-ALIGN:CENTER;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN,TIMES,SERIF;FONT-SIZE: 11PT;">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	4
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
</FONT>
</P>
</DIV>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-LEFT:10.2941176470588%;MARGIN-RIGHT:10.2941176470588%;">
<HR ALIGN="CENTER" STYLE='BACKGROUND-COLOR:#000000; BORDER-WIDTH:0; COLOR:#000000; HEIGHT:2PT; LINEHEIGHT:0; WIDTH:100%;'>
</HR>
<P STYLE="PAGE-BREAK-AFTER:ALWAYS">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<A NAME="eolPage5"></A>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-LEFT:10.2941176470588%;MARGIN-RIGHT:10.2941176470588%;">
<DIV STYLE="WIDTH:100%">
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT 0PT 30PT;COLOR:#0563C1;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN,TIMES,SERIF;FONT-SIZE: 10PT;">
<A HREF="#URG-20151231X10K_HTM_TOC">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;COLOR:#0563C1;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	Table of Contents
</FONT>

<EFX_UNIDENTIFIED_TABLE>
<A NAME="FIS_UNIDENTIFIED_TABLE_3"></A>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-LEFT:10.2941176470588%;MARGIN-RIGHT:10.2941176470588%;">
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT;TEXT-ALIGN:CENTER;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN,TIMES,SERIF;FONT-SIZE: 11PT;">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;FONT-WEIGHT:BOLD;FONT-STYLE:ITALIC;">
	Glossary of Common Terms and Abbreviations
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;TEXT-JUSTIFY:INTER-IDEOGRAPH;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN,TIMES,SERIF;FONT-SIZE: 11PT;">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<DIV STYLE="WIDTH:100%;">
<TABLE CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" ALIGN="CENTER" STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE;WIDTH: 100.00%;BACKGROUND-COLOR: #FFFFFF;MARGIN-LEFT:0PT;">
<TR>
<TD VALIGN="TOP" STYLE="WIDTH:28.86%;BORDER-TOP:1PT NONE #D9D9D9 ;BORDER-LEFT:1PT NONE #D9D9D9 ;BORDER-BOTTOM:1PT NONE #D9D9D9 ;BORDER-RIGHT:1PT NONE #D9D9D9 ;BACKGROUND-COLOR: #FFFFFF;PADDING:0PT 0PT 0PT 0PT;HEIGHT:1.00PT">
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;TEXT-JUSTIFY:INTER-IDEOGRAPH;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN,TIMES,SERIF;HEIGHT:1.00PT;OVERFLOW:HIDDEN;FONT-SIZE:0PT;">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;FONT-SIZE:1PT;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
</TD>
<TD VALIGN="TOP" STYLE="WIDTH:71.14%;BORDER-TOP:1PT NONE #D9D9D9 ;BORDER-LEFT:1PT NONE #D9D9D9 ;BORDER-BOTTOM:1PT NONE #D9D9D9 ;BORDER-RIGHT:1PT NONE #D9D9D9 ;BACKGROUND-COLOR: #FFFFFF;PADDING:0PT 0PT 0PT 0PT;HEIGHT:1.00PT">
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;TEXT-JUSTIFY:INTER-IDEOGRAPH;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN,TIMES,SERIF;HEIGHT:1.00PT;OVERFLOW:HIDDEN;FONT-SIZE:0PT;">
	&nbsp;
</P>
</TD>
</TR>
<TR>
<TD VALIGN="TOP" STYLE="BORDER-RIGHT:1PT NONE #D9D9D9 ;BORDER-BOTTOM:1PT NONE #D9D9D9 ;BORDER-TOP:1PT NONE #D9D9D9 ;BORDER-LEFT:1PT NONE #D9D9D9 ;WIDTH:28.86%;BACKGROUND-COLOR: #FFFFFF;PADDING:0PT 0PT 0PT 0PT;">
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;TEXT-JUSTIFY:INTER-IDEOGRAPH;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN,TIMES,SERIF;FONT-SIZE: 10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	Mineral&nbsp;Resource&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
</TD>
<TD VALIGN="TOP" STYLE="BORDER-LEFT:1PT NONE #D9D9D9 ;BORDER-BOTTOM:1PT NONE #D9D9D9 ;BORDER-TOP:1PT NONE #D9D9D9 ;BORDER-RIGHT:1PT NONE #D9D9D9 ;WIDTH:71.14%;BACKGROUND-COLOR: #FFFFFF;PADDING:0PT 0PT 0PT 0PT;">
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;TEXT-JUSTIFY:INTER-IDEOGRAPH;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN,TIMES,SERIF;FONT-SIZE: 10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;COLOR:#000000;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	is a concentration or occurrence of solid material of economic interest in or on the Earth&#x2019;s crust in such form, grade or quality and quantity that there are reasonable prospects for eventual economic extraction. The location, quantity, grade or quality, continuity and other geological characteristics of a Mineral Resource are known, estimated or interpreted from specific geological evidence and knowledge, including sampling.
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	CIM Definition Standards; NI 43-101, Section 1.1.
</FONT>
</P>
</TD>
</TR>
<TR>
<TD VALIGN="TOP" STYLE="BORDER-RIGHT:1PT NONE #D9D9D9 ;BORDER-BOTTOM:1PT NONE #D9D9D9 ;BORDER-TOP:1PT NONE #D9D9D9 ;BORDER-LEFT:1PT NONE #D9D9D9 ;WIDTH:28.86%;BACKGROUND-COLOR: #FFFFFF;PADDING:0PT 0PT 0PT 0PT;">
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;TEXT-JUSTIFY:INTER-IDEOGRAPH;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN,TIMES,SERIF;FONT-SIZE: 10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
</TD>
<TD VALIGN="TOP" STYLE="BORDER-LEFT:1PT NONE #D9D9D9 ;BORDER-BOTTOM:1PT NONE #D9D9D9 ;BORDER-TOP:1PT NONE #D9D9D9 ;BORDER-RIGHT:1PT NONE #D9D9D9 ;WIDTH:71.14%;BACKGROUND-COLOR: #FFFFFF;PADDING:0PT 0PT 0PT 0PT;">
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;TEXT-JUSTIFY:INTER-IDEOGRAPH;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN,TIMES,SERIF;FONT-SIZE: 11PT;">
	&nbsp;
</P>
</TD>
</TR>
<TR>
<TD VALIGN="TOP" STYLE="BORDER-RIGHT:1PT NONE #D9D9D9 ;BORDER-BOTTOM:1PT NONE #D9D9D9 ;BORDER-TOP:1PT NONE #D9D9D9 ;BORDER-LEFT:1PT NONE #D9D9D9 ;WIDTH:28.86%;BACKGROUND-COLOR: #FFFFFF;PADDING:0PT 0PT 0PT 0PT;">
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;TEXT-JUSTIFY:INTER-IDEOGRAPH;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN,TIMES,SERIF;FONT-SIZE: 10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	Inferred Mineral Resource
</FONT>
</P>
</TD>
<TD VALIGN="TOP" STYLE="BORDER-LEFT:1PT NONE #D9D9D9 ;BORDER-BOTTOM:1PT NONE #D9D9D9 ;BORDER-TOP:1PT NONE #D9D9D9 ;BORDER-RIGHT:1PT NONE #D9D9D9 ;WIDTH:71.14%;BACKGROUND-COLOR: #FFFFFF;PADDING:0PT 0PT 0PT 0PT;">
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;TEXT-JUSTIFY:INTER-IDEOGRAPH;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN,TIMES,SERIF;FONT-SIZE: 10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	is that part of a Mineral Resource for which quantity and grade or quality are estimated on the basis of limited geological evidence and sampling. Geologic evidence is
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	sufficient to imply but not verify geological and grade or quality continuity.
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;COLOR:#000000;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	An Inferred Mineral Resource has a lower level of confidence than that applying to an Indicated Mineral Resource and must not be converted to a Mineral Reserve. It is reasonably expected that the majority of Inferred Mineral Resources could be upgraded to Indicated Mineral Resources with continued exploration.
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	&nbsp;CIM Definition Standards; NI 43-101, Section 1.1.
</FONT>
</P>
</TD>
</TR>
<TR>
<TD VALIGN="TOP" STYLE="BORDER-RIGHT:1PT NONE #D9D9D9 ;BORDER-BOTTOM:1PT NONE #D9D9D9 ;BORDER-TOP:1PT NONE #D9D9D9 ;BORDER-LEFT:1PT NONE #D9D9D9 ;WIDTH:28.86%;BACKGROUND-COLOR: #FFFFFF;PADDING:0PT 0PT 0PT 0PT;">
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;TEXT-JUSTIFY:INTER-IDEOGRAPH;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN,TIMES,SERIF;FONT-SIZE: 10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
</TD>
<TD VALIGN="TOP" STYLE="BORDER-LEFT:1PT NONE #D9D9D9 ;BORDER-BOTTOM:1PT NONE #D9D9D9 ;BORDER-TOP:1PT NONE #D9D9D9 ;BORDER-RIGHT:1PT NONE #D9D9D9 ;WIDTH:71.14%;BACKGROUND-COLOR: #FFFFFF;PADDING:0PT 0PT 0PT 0PT;">
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;TEXT-JUSTIFY:INTER-IDEOGRAPH;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN,TIMES,SERIF;FONT-SIZE: 11PT;">
	&nbsp;
</P>
</TD>
</TR>
<TR>
<TD VALIGN="TOP" STYLE="BORDER-RIGHT:1PT NONE #D9D9D9 ;BORDER-BOTTOM:1PT NONE #D9D9D9 ;BORDER-TOP:1PT NONE #D9D9D9 ;BORDER-LEFT:1PT NONE #D9D9D9 ;WIDTH:28.86%;BACKGROUND-COLOR: #FFFFFF;PADDING:0PT 0PT 0PT 0PT;">
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;TEXT-JUSTIFY:INTER-IDEOGRAPH;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN,TIMES,SERIF;FONT-SIZE: 10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	Indicated Mineral Resource
</FONT>
</P>
</TD>
<TD VALIGN="TOP" STYLE="BORDER-LEFT:1PT NONE #D9D9D9 ;BORDER-BOTTOM:1PT NONE #D9D9D9 ;BORDER-TOP:1PT NONE #D9D9D9 ;BORDER-RIGHT:1PT NONE #D9D9D9 ;WIDTH:71.14%;BACKGROUND-COLOR: #FFFFFF;PADDING:0PT 0PT 0PT 0PT;">
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;TEXT-JUSTIFY:INTER-IDEOGRAPH;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN,TIMES,SERIF;FONT-SIZE: 10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	i
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	s that part of a Mineral Resource for which quantity, grade or quality, densities, shape and physical characteristics are estimated with sufficient confidence to allow the application of Modifying Factors in sufficient detail to support mine planning and evaluation of the economic viability of the deposit. Geological evidence is derived from adequately detailed and reliable exploration, sampling and testing and is sufficient to assume geological and grade or quality continuity between points of observation. An Indicated Mineral Resource has a lower level of confidence than that applying to a Measured Mineral Resource and may only be converted to a Probable Mineral Reserve.
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	CIM Definition Standards; NI 43-101, Section 1.1.
</FONT>
</P>
</TD>
</TR>
<TR>
<TD VALIGN="TOP" STYLE="BORDER-RIGHT:1PT NONE #D9D9D9 ;BORDER-BOTTOM:1PT NONE #D9D9D9 ;BORDER-TOP:1PT NONE #D9D9D9 ;BORDER-LEFT:1PT NONE #D9D9D9 ;WIDTH:28.86%;BACKGROUND-COLOR: #FFFFFF;PADDING:0PT 0PT 0PT 0PT;">
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;TEXT-JUSTIFY:INTER-IDEOGRAPH;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN,TIMES,SERIF;FONT-SIZE: 10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
</TD>
<TD VALIGN="TOP" STYLE="BORDER-LEFT:1PT NONE #D9D9D9 ;BORDER-BOTTOM:1PT NONE #D9D9D9 ;BORDER-TOP:1PT NONE #D9D9D9 ;BORDER-RIGHT:1PT NONE #D9D9D9 ;WIDTH:71.14%;BACKGROUND-COLOR: #FFFFFF;PADDING:0PT 0PT 0PT 0PT;">
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;TEXT-JUSTIFY:INTER-IDEOGRAPH;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN,TIMES,SERIF;FONT-SIZE: 11PT;">
	&nbsp;
</P>
</TD>
</TR>
<TR>
<TD VALIGN="TOP" STYLE="BORDER-RIGHT:1PT NONE #D9D9D9 ;BORDER-BOTTOM:1PT NONE #D9D9D9 ;BORDER-TOP:1PT NONE #D9D9D9 ;BORDER-LEFT:1PT NONE #D9D9D9 ;WIDTH:28.86%;BACKGROUND-COLOR: #FFFFFF;PADDING:0PT 0PT 0PT 0PT;">
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;TEXT-JUSTIFY:INTER-IDEOGRAPH;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN,TIMES,SERIF;FONT-SIZE: 10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	Measured Mineral Resource
</FONT>
</P>
</TD>
<TD VALIGN="TOP" STYLE="BORDER-LEFT:1PT NONE #D9D9D9 ;BORDER-BOTTOM:1PT NONE #D9D9D9 ;BORDER-TOP:1PT NONE #D9D9D9 ;BORDER-RIGHT:1PT NONE #D9D9D9 ;WIDTH:71.14%;BACKGROUND-COLOR: #FFFFFF;PADDING:0PT 0PT 0PT 0PT;">
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;TEXT-JUSTIFY:INTER-IDEOGRAPH;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN,TIMES,SERIF;FONT-SIZE: 10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	is that part of a Mineral Resource for which quantity, grade or quality, densities, shape, and physical characteristics are estimated with confidence sufficient to allow the application of Modifying Factors to support detailed mine planning and final evaluation of the economic viability of the deposit. Geological evidence is derived from detailed and reliable exploration, sampling and testing and is sufficient to confirm geological and grade or quality continuity between points of observation. A Measured Mineral Resource has a higher level of confidence than that applying to either an Indicated Mineral Resource or an Inferred Mineral Resource. It may be converted to a Proven Mineral Reserve or to a Probable Mineral Reserve.
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	CIM Definition Standards; NI 43-101, Section 1.1.
</FONT>
</P>
</TD>
</TR>
<TR>
<TD VALIGN="TOP" STYLE="BORDER-RIGHT:1PT NONE #D9D9D9 ;BORDER-BOTTOM:1PT NONE #D9D9D9 ;BORDER-TOP:1PT NONE #D9D9D9 ;BORDER-LEFT:1PT NONE #D9D9D9 ;WIDTH:28.86%;BACKGROUND-COLOR: #FFFFFF;PADDING:0PT 0PT 0PT 0PT;">
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;TEXT-JUSTIFY:INTER-IDEOGRAPH;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN,TIMES,SERIF;FONT-SIZE: 10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
</TD>
<TD VALIGN="TOP" STYLE="BORDER-LEFT:1PT NONE #D9D9D9 ;BORDER-BOTTOM:1PT NONE #D9D9D9 ;BORDER-TOP:1PT NONE #D9D9D9 ;BORDER-RIGHT:1PT NONE #D9D9D9 ;WIDTH:71.14%;BACKGROUND-COLOR: #FFFFFF;PADDING:0PT 0PT 0PT 0PT;">
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;TEXT-JUSTIFY:INTER-IDEOGRAPH;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN,TIMES,SERIF;FONT-SIZE: 11PT;">
	&nbsp;
</P>
</TD>
</TR>
<TR>
<TD VALIGN="TOP" STYLE="BORDER-RIGHT:1PT NONE #D9D9D9 ;BORDER-BOTTOM:1PT NONE #D9D9D9 ;BORDER-TOP:1PT NONE #D9D9D9 ;BORDER-LEFT:1PT NONE #D9D9D9 ;WIDTH:28.86%;BACKGROUND-COLOR: #FFFFFF;PADDING:0PT 0PT 0PT 0PT;">
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;TEXT-JUSTIFY:INTER-IDEOGRAPH;COLOR:#000000;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN,TIMES,SERIF;FONT-SIZE: 10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	Modifying Factors
</FONT>
</P>
</TD>
<TD VALIGN="TOP" STYLE="BORDER-LEFT:1PT NONE #D9D9D9 ;BORDER-BOTTOM:1PT NONE #D9D9D9 ;BORDER-TOP:1PT NONE #D9D9D9 ;BORDER-RIGHT:1PT NONE #D9D9D9 ;WIDTH:71.14%;BACKGROUND-COLOR: #FFFFFF;PADDING:0PT 0PT 0PT 0PT;">
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;TEXT-JUSTIFY:INTER-IDEOGRAPH;COLOR:#000000;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN,TIMES,SERIF;FONT-SIZE: 10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	are considerations used to convert Mineral Resources to Mineral Reserves. These include, but are not restricted to, mining, processing, metallurgical, infrastructure, economic, marketing, legal, environmental, social and governmental factors.
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	CIM Definition Standards
</FONT>
</P>
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
</DIV>
</DIV>
</EFX_UNIDENTIFIED_TABLE>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-LEFT:10.2941176470588%;MARGIN-RIGHT:10.2941176470588%;">
<P>
<FONT SIZE="1">
</FONT>
</P>
<DIV STYLE="WIDTH:100%">
<P STYLE="MARGIN:24PT 0PT 0PT;TEXT-ALIGN:CENTER;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN,TIMES,SERIF;FONT-SIZE: 11PT;">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	5
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
</FONT>
</P>
</DIV>

<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-LEFT:10.2941176470588%;MARGIN-RIGHT:10.2941176470588%;">

	&nbsp;

<A NAME="eolPage6"></A>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-LEFT:10.2941176470588%;MARGIN-RIGHT:10.2941176470588%;">
<DIV STYLE="WIDTH:100%">
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT 0PT 30PT;COLOR:#0563C1;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN,TIMES,SERIF;FONT-SIZE: 10PT;">
<A HREF="#URG-20151231X10K_HTM_TOC">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;COLOR:#0563C1;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	Table of Contents
</FONT>
</A>
</P>
</DIV>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-LEFT:10.2941176470588%;MARGIN-RIGHT:10.2941176470588%;">
<EFX_UNIDENTIFIED_TABLE>
<A NAME="FIS_UNIDENTIFIED_TABLE_4"></A>
<DIV STYLE="WIDTH:100%;">
<TABLE CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" ALIGN="CENTER" STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE;WIDTH: 100.00%;BACKGROUND-COLOR: #FFFFFF;MARGIN-LEFT:0PT;">
<TR>
<TD VALIGN="TOP" STYLE="BORDER-RIGHT:1PT NONE #D9D9D9 ;BORDER-BOTTOM:1PT NONE #D9D9D9 ;BORDER-TOP:1PT NONE #D9D9D9 ;BORDER-LEFT:1PT NONE #D9D9D9 ;WIDTH:28.86%;BACKGROUND-COLOR: #FFFFFF;PADDING:0PT 0PT 0PT 0PT;">
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;TEXT-JUSTIFY:INTER-IDEOGRAPH;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN,TIMES,SERIF;FONT-SIZE: 10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
</TD>
<TD VALIGN="TOP" STYLE="BORDER-LEFT:1PT NONE #D9D9D9 ;BORDER-BOTTOM:1PT NONE #D9D9D9 ;BORDER-TOP:1PT NONE #D9D9D9 ;BORDER-RIGHT:1PT NONE #D9D9D9 ;WIDTH:71.14%;BACKGROUND-COLOR: #FFFFFF;PADDING:0PT 0PT 0PT 0PT;">
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;TEXT-JUSTIFY:INTER-IDEOGRAPH;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN,TIMES,SERIF;FONT-SIZE: 11PT;">
	&nbsp;
</P>
</TD>
</TR>
<TR>
<TD VALIGN="TOP" STYLE="BORDER-RIGHT:1PT NONE #D9D9D9 ;BORDER-BOTTOM:1PT NONE #D9D9D9 ;BORDER-TOP:1PT NONE #D9D9D9 ;BORDER-LEFT:1PT NONE #D9D9D9 ;WIDTH:28.86%;BACKGROUND-COLOR: #FFFFFF;PADDING:0PT 0PT 0PT 0PT;">
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;TEXT-JUSTIFY:INTER-IDEOGRAPH;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN,TIMES,SERIF;FONT-SIZE: 10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	Lithology
</FONT>
</P>
</TD>
<TD VALIGN="TOP" STYLE="BORDER-LEFT:1PT NONE #D9D9D9 ;BORDER-BOTTOM:1PT NONE #D9D9D9 ;BORDER-TOP:1PT NONE #D9D9D9 ;BORDER-RIGHT:1PT NONE #D9D9D9 ;WIDTH:71.14%;BACKGROUND-COLOR: #FFFFFF;PADDING:0PT 0PT 0PT 0PT;">
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;TEXT-JUSTIFY:INTER-IDEOGRAPH;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN,TIMES,SERIF;FONT-SIZE: 10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	is a description of a rock; generally its physical nature.&nbsp; The description would address such things as grain size, texture, rounding, and even chemical composition.&nbsp; A lithologic description would be: coarse grained well rounded quartz sandstone with 10% pink feldspar and 1% muscovite.
</FONT>
</P>
</TD>
</TR>
<TR>
<TD VALIGN="TOP" STYLE="BORDER-RIGHT:1PT NONE #D9D9D9 ;BORDER-BOTTOM:1PT NONE #D9D9D9 ;BORDER-TOP:1PT NONE #D9D9D9 ;BORDER-LEFT:1PT NONE #D9D9D9 ;WIDTH:28.86%;BACKGROUND-COLOR: #FFFFFF;PADDING:0PT 0PT 0PT 0PT;">
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;TEXT-JUSTIFY:INTER-IDEOGRAPH;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN,TIMES,SERIF;FONT-SIZE: 10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
</TD>
<TD VALIGN="TOP" STYLE="BORDER-LEFT:1PT NONE #D9D9D9 ;BORDER-BOTTOM:1PT NONE #D9D9D9 ;BORDER-TOP:1PT NONE #D9D9D9 ;BORDER-RIGHT:1PT NONE #D9D9D9 ;WIDTH:71.14%;BACKGROUND-COLOR: #FFFFFF;PADDING:0PT 0PT 0PT 0PT;">
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;TEXT-JUSTIFY:INTER-IDEOGRAPH;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN,TIMES,SERIF;FONT-SIZE: 11PT;">
	&nbsp;
</P>
</TD>
</TR>
<TR>
<TD VALIGN="TOP" STYLE="BORDER-RIGHT:1PT NONE #D9D9D9 ;BORDER-TOP:1PT NONE #D9D9D9 ;BORDER-LEFT:1PT NONE #D9D9D9 ;BORDER-BOTTOM:1PT NONE #D9D9D9 ;WIDTH:28.86%;BACKGROUND-COLOR: #FFFFFF;PADDING:0PT 0PT 0PT 0PT;">
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;TEXT-JUSTIFY:INTER-IDEOGRAPH;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN,TIMES,SERIF;FONT-SIZE: 10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	PFN&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
</TD>
<TD VALIGN="TOP" STYLE="BORDER-LEFT:1PT NONE #D9D9D9 ;BORDER-TOP:1PT NONE #D9D9D9 ;BORDER-RIGHT:1PT NONE #D9D9D9 ;BORDER-BOTTOM:1PT NONE #D9D9D9 ;WIDTH:71.14%;BACKGROUND-COLOR: #FFFFFF;PADDING:0PT 0PT 0PT 0PT;">
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;TEXT-JUSTIFY:INTER-IDEOGRAPH;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN,TIMES,SERIF;FONT-SIZE: 10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	is a modern geologic logging method known as Prompt Fission Neutron.&nbsp;&nbsp;PFN is considered a direct measurement of true uranium concentration (% U) and is used to verify the grades of mineral intercepts previously reported by gamma logging.&nbsp;&nbsp;PFN logging is accomplished by a down-hole probe in much the same manner as gamma logs, however only the mineralized interval plus a buffer interval above and below are logged.
</FONT>
</P>
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
</DIV>
</EFX_UNIDENTIFIED_TABLE>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;TEXT-JUSTIFY:INTER-IDEOGRAPH;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN,TIMES,SERIF;FONT-SIZE: 11PT;">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>

<EFX_PART_I>
<A NAME="FIS_PART_I"></A>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT;TEXT-ALIGN:CENTER;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN,TIMES,SERIF;FONT-SIZE: 11PT;">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;FONT-WEIGHT:BOLD;">
	PAR
</FONT>

<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN,TIMES,SERIF;FONT-SIZE: 11PT;">

<EFX_BUSINESS>
<A NAME="FIS_BUSINESS"></A>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT;LINE-HEIGHT:95.83%;TEXT-ALIGN:CENTER;COLOR:#000000;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN,TIMES,SERIF;FONT-SIZE: 11PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-WEIGHT:BOLD;DISPLAY:INLINE;COLOR:#000000;">
	Items 1 and 2.&nbsp;&nbsp;BUSINESS AND PROPERTIE
</FONT>
<A NAME="URG-20151231X10K_HTM_ITEMS1AND2BUSINESSANDPROPERTIES_605826">
</A>
<FONT STYLE="FONT-WEIGHT:BOLD;DISPLAY:INLINE;COLOR:#000000;">
	S
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT;LINE-HEIGHT:95.83%;COLOR:#000000;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN,TIMES,SERIF;FONT-SIZE: 11PT;">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT;LINE-HEIGHT:95.83%;COLOR:#000000;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN,TIMES,SERIF;FONT-SIZE: 11PT;">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-WEIGHT:BOLD;DISPLAY:INLINE;COLOR:#000000;">
	Overview and Corporate Structure
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT;LINE-HEIGHT:95.83%;COLOR:#000000;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN,TIMES,SERIF;FONT-SIZE: 11PT;">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT;BORDER-BOTTOM:1PT NONE #D9D9D9 ;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;TEXT-JUSTIFY:INTER-IDEOGRAPH;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN,TIMES,SERIF;FONT-SIZE: 11PT;">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	Incorporated on March 22, 2004, Ur-Energy is an exploration stage mining company, as that term is defined in
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	Securities and Exchange Commission (&#x201C;SEC&#x201D;)
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	Industry Guide 7.
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	We are engaged in
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	uranium mining, recovery and processing activities, including
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	the acquisition, exploration, development and operation of uranium mineral properties in the United States. We beg
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	a
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	n operation of our first in situ recovery uranium mine at our Lost Creek Project, Wyoming
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	in 2013
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	. Ur-Energy is a corporation continued under the
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;FONT-STYLE:ITALIC;">
	Canada Business Corporations Act
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	on August 8, 2006. Our
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	C
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	ommon
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	S
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	hares are listed on the TSX under the symbol &#x201C;URE&#x201D; and on the NYSE MKT under the symbol &#x201C;URG.&#x201D;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT;BORDER-TOP:1PT NONE #D9D9D9 ;BORDER-BOTTOM:1PT NONE #D9D9D9 ;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;TEXT-JUSTIFY:INTER-IDEOGRAPH;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN,TIMES,SERIF;FONT-SIZE: 11PT;">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT;BORDER-TOP:1PT NONE #D9D9D9 ;BORDER-BOTTOM:1PT NONE #D9D9D9 ;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;TEXT-JUSTIFY:INTER-IDEOGRAPH;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN,TIMES,SERIF;FONT-SIZE: 11PT;">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	Ur-Energy has one
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	direct
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	wholly-owned subsidiary: Ur-Energy USA Inc. (&#x201C;Ur-Energy USA&#x201D;), a company incorporated under the laws of the State of Colorado.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT;BORDER-TOP:1PT NONE #D9D9D9 ;BORDER-BOTTOM:1PT NONE #D9D9D9 ;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;TEXT-JUSTIFY:INTER-IDEOGRAPH;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN,TIMES,SERIF;FONT-SIZE: 11PT;">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT;BORDER-TOP:1PT NONE #D9D9D9 ;BORDER-BOTTOM:1PT NONE #D9D9D9 ;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;TEXT-JUSTIFY:INTER-IDEOGRAPH;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN,TIMES,SERIF;FONT-SIZE: 11PT;">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	Ur-Energy USA has three wholly-owned subsidiaries: NFU Wyoming, LLC (&#x201C;NFU Wyoming&#x201D;), a limited liability company formed under the laws of the State of Wyoming to facilitate acquisition of certain property and assets and, currently, to act as our land holding and exploration entity; Lost Creek ISR, LLC, a limited liability company formed under the laws of the State of Wyoming to hold and operate our Lost Creek Project and certain other of our Lost Creek properties and assets; and Pathfinder Mines Corporation (&#x201C;Pathfinder&#x201D;), a company incorporated under the laws of the State of Delaware, which holds, among other assets, the Shirley Basin and Lucky Mc properties in Wyoming.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT;BORDER-TOP:1PT NONE #D9D9D9 ;BORDER-BOTTOM:1PT NONE #D9D9D9 ;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;TEXT-JUSTIFY:INTER-IDEOGRAPH;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN,TIMES,SERIF;FONT-SIZE: 11PT;">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT;BORDER-TOP:1PT NONE #D9D9D9 ;BORDER-BOTTOM:1PT NONE #D9D9D9 ;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;TEXT-JUSTIFY:INTER-IDEOGRAPH;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN,TIMES,SERIF;FONT-SIZE: 11PT;">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	Ur-Energy USA has two jointly held subsidiaries with NFU Wyoming: NFUR Bootheel, LLC
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	(&#x201C;NFUR Bootheel&#x201D;)
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	, a limited liability company formed under the laws of the State of Colorado to facilitate participation in an exploration, mining and development agreement with Jet Metal Corp.; and NFUR Hauber, LLC
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	(&#x201C;NFUR Hauber&#x201D;)
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	, a limited liability company formed under the laws of the State of Colorado to facilitate participation in a venture project at our Hauber project.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT;BORDER-TOP:1PT NONE #D9D9D9 ;BORDER-BOTTOM:1PT NONE #D9D9D9 ;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;TEXT-JUSTIFY:INTER-IDEOGRAPH;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN,TIMES,SERIF;FONT-SIZE: 11PT;">

	2012
</FONT>

</FONT>

	from

	the U

	.

	i

	n August

<DIV STYLE="WIDTH:100%">
<P STYLE="MARGIN:24PT 0PT 0PT;TEXT-ALIGN:CENTER;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN,TIMES,SERIF;FONT-SIZE: 11PT;">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	8
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">

<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-LEFT:10.2941176470588%;MARGIN-RIGHT:10.2941176470588%;">
<HR ALIGN="CENTER" STYLE='BACKGROUND-COLOR:#000000; BORDER-WIDTH:0; COLOR:#000000; HEIGHT:2PT; LINEHEIGHT:0; WIDTH:100%;'>
</HR>
<P STYLE="PAGE-BREAK-AFTER:ALWAYS">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<A NAME="eolPage9"></A>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-LEFT:10.2941176470588%;MARGIN-RIGHT:10.2941176470588%;">
<DIV STYLE="WIDTH:100%">
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT 0PT 30PT;COLOR:#0563C1;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN,TIMES,SERIF;FONT-SIZE: 10PT;">
<A HREF="#URG-20151231X10K_HTM_TOC">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;COLOR:#0563C1;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	Table of Contents
</FONT>
</A>
</P>
</DIV>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-LEFT:10.2941176470588%;MARGIN-RIGHT:10.2941176470588%;">
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT 0PT 6PT;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;TEXT-JUSTIFY:INTER-IDEOGRAPH;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN,TIMES,SERIF;FONT-SIZE: 11PT;">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	The Company has contractually committed to sell 662,000 pounds of uranium yellowcake during 2016, at an average price of approximately US$47 per pound. During 2015, we worked with our customers to establish our delivery schedule for those commitments, with distribution of sales throughout the year. This schedule was created in an attempt to avoid uneven cash flows that could result from uneven delivery schedules. In mid-January 2016, certain deliveries with an anticipated schedule for first quarter delivery were moved to mid-year delivery dates, causing unevenness of cash flow in the first half of the year. This development was addressed promptly by the Company examining various alternatives in scheduling of deliveries and sales and other financing prospects.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;TEXT-JUSTIFY:INTER-IDEOGRAPH;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN,TIMES,SERIF;FONT-SIZE: 11PT;">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	Our newest project, Shirley Basin, is one of the assets we acquired as a part of the Pathfinder transaction which closed in December 2013. We also acquired all the historic geologic and engineering data for the project. During 2014, we completed a drill program of a limited number of confirmatory holes in order to complete an
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	NI&nbsp;43
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	&#8209;101
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	mineral resource estimate which was released in August 2014; subsequently, an NI 43-101 Preliminary Economic Assessment for Shirley Basin was completed in January 2015. Baseline studies necessary for the permitting and licensing of the project commenced in 2014 and were completed in 2015. Subsequently, in December 2015, our application for a permit to mine was submitted to the State of Wyoming Department of Environmental Quality
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	(&#x201C;WDEQ&#x201D;)
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	. &nbsp;
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	Work
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;COLOR:#000000;">
	is well underway
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	on other
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;COLOR:#000000;">
	application
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;COLOR:#000000;">
	s
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;COLOR:#000000;">
	for
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;COLOR:#000000;">
	necessary authorizations to mine at Shirley Basin
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;COLOR:#000000;">
	.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:12PT 0PT 0PT;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;TEXT-JUSTIFY:INTER-IDEOGRAPH;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN,TIMES,SERIF;FONT-SIZE: 11PT;">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	We utilize in situ recovery of the uranium at Lost
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	Creek and will do so at other projects where this is possible. The in situ recovery (ISR) technique is employed in uranium extraction because it allows for a lower cost and effective recovery of roll front mineralization. The in situ technique does not require the installation of tailings facilities or significant surface disturbance. This mining method utilizes injection wells to introduce a mining solution, called lixiviant, into the mineralized zone. The lixiviant is made of natural groundwater fortified with oxygen as an oxidizer, sodium bicarbonate as a complexing agent, and carbon dioxide for pH control. The complexing agent bonds with the uranium to form uranyl carbonate, which is highly soluble. The dissolved uranyl carbonate is then recovered through a series of production wells and piped to a processing plant where the uranyl carbonate is removed from the solution using Ion Exchange (IX) and captured on resin contained within the IX columns. The groundwater is re-fortified with the oxidizer and complexing agent and sent back to the wellfield to recover additional uranium. A low-volume bleed is permanently removed from the lixiviant flow. A reverse osmosis (RO) process is available to minimize the waste water stream generated. Brine from the RO process, if used, and bleed are disposed of by means of injection into deep disposal wells. Each wellfield is made up of dozens of injection and production wells installed in patterns to optimize the areal sweep of
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	fluid through
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	the uranium ore body.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT 0PT 0PT 36PT;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;TEXT-JUSTIFY:INTER-IDEOGRAPH;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN,TIMES,SERIF;FONT-SIZE: 11PT;">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;TEXT-JUSTIFY:INTER-IDEOGRAPH;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN,TIMES,SERIF;FONT-SIZE: 11PT;">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	Our Lost Creek processing facility includes all circuits for the capture, concentration, drying and packaging of uranium yellowcake for delivery into sales. Our processing facility, in addition to the IX circuit, includes dual processing trains with separate elution, precipitation, filter press and drying circuits (this is in contrast to certain other uranium in situ recovery facilities which operate as a capture plant (IX) only, and rely on agreements with other producers for the finishing, drying and packaging of their yellowcake end-product). Additionally, a restoration circuit including a RO unit was installed during initial construction to complete groundwater restoration once mining is complete.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;TEXT-JUSTIFY:INTER-IDEOGRAPH;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN,TIMES,SERIF;FONT-SIZE: 11PT;">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;TEXT-JUSTIFY:INTER-IDEOGRAPH;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN,TIMES,SERIF;FONT-SIZE: 11PT;">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	The elution circuit (the first step after ion exchange) is utilized to transfer the uranium from the IX resin and concentrate it to the point where it is ready for the next phase of processing.
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	The resulting rich eluate is an aqueous solution containing uranyl carbonate, salt and sodium carbonate and/or sodium bicarbonate.
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	The precipitation circuit follows the elution circuit and removes the carbonate from the concentrated uranium solution and combines the uranium with peroxide to create a yellowcake crystal slurry. Filtration and washing is the next step, in which the slurry is loaded into a filter press where excess contaminants such as chloride are removed and a large portion of the water is removed. The final stage occurs when the dewatered slurry is moved
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
</FONT>
</P>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-LEFT:10.2941176470588%;MARGIN-RIGHT:10.2941176470588%;">
<P>
<FONT SIZE="1">
</FONT>
</P>
<DIV STYLE="WIDTH:100%">
<P STYLE="MARGIN:24PT 0PT 0PT;TEXT-ALIGN:CENTER;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN,TIMES,SERIF;FONT-SIZE: 11PT;">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	9
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
</FONT>
</P>
</DIV>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-LEFT:10.2941176470588%;MARGIN-RIGHT:10.2941176470588%;">
<HR ALIGN="CENTER" STYLE='BACKGROUND-COLOR:#000000; BORDER-WIDTH:0; COLOR:#000000; HEIGHT:2PT; LINEHEIGHT:0; WIDTH:100%;'>
</HR>
<P STYLE="PAGE-BREAK-AFTER:ALWAYS">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<A NAME="eolPage10"></A>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-LEFT:10.2941176470588%;MARGIN-RIGHT:10.2941176470588%;">
<DIV STYLE="WIDTH:100%">
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT 0PT 30PT;COLOR:#0563C1;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN,TIMES,SERIF;FONT-SIZE: 10PT;">
<A HREF="#URG-20151231X10K_HTM_TOC">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;COLOR:#0563C1;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	Table of Contents
</FONT>
</A>
</P>
</DIV>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-LEFT:10.2941176470588%;MARGIN-RIGHT:10.2941176470588%;">
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;TEXT-JUSTIFY:INTER-IDEOGRAPH;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN,TIMES,SERIF;FONT-SIZE: 11PT;">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	to a yellowcake dryer, which will further reduce the moisture content, yielding the final dried, free-flowing, product. Refined, salable yellowcake is packaged in 55-gallon steel drums.&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT 0PT 0PT 36PT;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;TEXT-JUSTIFY:INTER-IDEOGRAPH;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN,TIMES,SERIF;FONT-SIZE: 11PT;">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT;BORDER-BOTTOM:1PT NONE #D9D9D9 ;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;TEXT-JUSTIFY:INTER-IDEOGRAPH;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN,TIMES,SERIF;FONT-SIZE: 11PT;">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	The restoration circuit may be utilized in the production as well as the post-mining phases of the operation. The RO may initially be utilized to minimize the waste water stream generated during production.
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	Once production is complete, the groundwater must be restored to its pre-mining class of use by removing a small portion of the groundwater and disposing of it (commonly known as sweep). Following sweep, the groundwater is treated utilizing RO and re-injecting the clean water. Finally, the groundwater is homogenized and sampled to insure the cleanup is complete,
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	thus ending the mining process.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT;BORDER-TOP:1PT NONE #D9D9D9 ;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;TEXT-JUSTIFY:INTER-IDEOGRAPH;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN,TIMES,SERIF;FONT-SIZE: 11PT;">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;TEXT-JUSTIFY:INTER-IDEOGRAPH;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN,TIMES,SERIF;FONT-SIZE: 11PT;">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	Our Lost Creek processing facility was constructed during 2012 &#x2013; 2013, with production operations commencing in August 2013. Our first sales were made in December 2013. Nameplate design and NRC-licensed capacity of our Lost Creek processing plant is two million pounds per year, of which approximately one million pounds per year may be produced from our wellfields. The Lost Creek plant and the allocation of resources to mine units and resource areas were designed to generate approximately one million pounds of production per year at certain flow rates and uranium concentrations subject to regulatory and license conditions. Production of refined yellowcake was 727,246 pounds and 547,992 pounds in 2015 and 2014, respectively. The excess capacity in the design of the processing circuits of the plant is intended, first, to facilitate routine (and, non-routine) maintenance on any particular circuit without hindering production operational schedules. The capacity was also designed to permit us to
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	process uranium from other of our mineral projects in proximity to Lost Creek if circumstances warrant in the future (
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;FONT-STYLE:ITALIC;">
	e.g.,
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	Shirley Basin Project), or, alternatively to be able to contract to toll mill/process product from other in situ uranium mine sites in the region. This design would permit us to conduct either of these activities while Lost Creek is producing and processing uranium and/or in years following Lost Creek production from wellfields during
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	final restoration activities.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;TEXT-JUSTIFY:INTER-IDEOGRAPH;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN,TIMES,SERIF;FONT-SIZE: 11PT;">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT;BORDER-BOTTOM:1PT NONE #D9D9D9 ;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;TEXT-JUSTIFY:INTER-IDEOGRAPH;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN,TIMES,SERIF;FONT-SIZE: 11PT;">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	Our Lost Creek processing facility includes all circuits for the production, drying and packaging of uranium yellowcake for delivery into sales.
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	As contemplated in the Preliminary Economic Assessment of Shirley Basin, w
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	e expect that the Lost Creek processing facility
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	may
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	be utilized for the drying and packaging of uranium from Shirley Basin, for which we currently anticipate the need only for a satellite plant.
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	However, the Shirley Basin permit application contemplates the construction of a full processing facility, providing greater construction and operating flexibility as may be dictated by market conditions.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT;BORDER-TOP:1PT NONE #D9D9D9 ;BORDER-BOTTOM:1PT NONE #D9D9D9 ;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;TEXT-JUSTIFY:INTER-IDEOGRAPH;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN,TIMES,SERIF;FONT-SIZE: 11PT;">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT;BORDER-TOP:1PT NONE #D9D9D9 ;BORDER-BOTTOM:1PT NONE #D9D9D9 ;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;TEXT-JUSTIFY:INTER-IDEOGRAPH;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN,TIMES,SERIF;FONT-SIZE: 11PT;">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;FONT-WEIGHT:BOLD;">
	Our Mineral Properties
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT;BORDER-TOP:1PT NONE #D9D9D9 ;BORDER-BOTTOM:1PT NONE #D9D9D9 ;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;TEXT-JUSTIFY:INTER-IDEOGRAPH;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN,TIMES,SERIF;FONT-SIZE: 11PT;">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT;BORDER-TOP:1PT NONE #D9D9D9 ;BORDER-BOTTOM:1PT NONE #D9D9D9 ;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;TEXT-JUSTIFY:INTER-IDEOGRAPH;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN,TIMES,SERIF;FONT-SIZE: 11PT;">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	Our current land portfolio includes 14 projects in
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	Wyoming
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	. Ten of the
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	se
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	projects are in the Great Divide Basin, Wyoming,
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	including
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	our flagship project, Lost Creek Project,
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	which
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	began production operations in August
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	2013
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	. Currently we control a total of more than 2,100 unpatented mining claims and four State of Wyoming mineral leases for a total of
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	more than
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	42,000 acres (16,997 hectares) in the area of the Lost Creek Property, including the Lost Creek permit area (the &#x201C;Lost Creek Project&#x201D; or &#x201C;
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	Lost Creek
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	&#x201D;) and certain adjoining properties which we refer to as LC East, LC West, LC North, LC South and EN project areas (collectively, with the Lost Creek Project, the &#x201C;Lost Creek Property&#x201D;).&nbsp;&nbsp;Five of the projects at the Lost Creek Property contain
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	NI&nbsp;
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	43-101 compliant mineral resources: Lost Creek, LC East, LC West, LC South and LC North.&nbsp;&nbsp;See Resource Summary
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
</FONT>
</P>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-LEFT:10.2941176470588%;MARGIN-RIGHT:10.2941176470588%;">

<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT;BORDER-TOP:1PT NONE #D9D9D9 ;BORDER-BOTTOM:1PT NONE #D9D9D9 ;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;TEXT-JUSTIFY:INTER-IDEOGRAPH;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN,TIMES,SERIF;FONT-SIZE: 11PT;">

	below
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	in
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;FONT-STYLE:ITALIC;">
	Technical Developments
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	. Below is a map showing our Wyoming projects and the geologic basins in which they are located.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT;BORDER-TOP:1PT NONE #D9D9D9 ;BORDER-BOTTOM:1PT NONE #D9D9D9 ;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;TEXT-JUSTIFY:INTER-IDEOGRAPH;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN,TIMES,SERIF;FONT-SIZE: 11PT;">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT;BORDER-TOP:1PT NONE #D9D9D9 ;BORDER-BOTTOM:1PT NONE #D9D9D9 ;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;TEXT-JUSTIFY:INTER-IDEOGRAPH;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN,TIMES,SERIF;FONT-SIZE: 11PT;">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
<IMG SRC="http://content.edgar-online.com/edgar_conv_img/2016/02/26/0001558370-16-003622_URG20151231X10K002.JPG" STYLE="WIDTH: 7.3IN; HEIGHT: 4.723529IN" ALT="//URE-EXCHANGE/PUBLIC/GIS/PRESENTATIONS/2014/PENNE_FEB/WY_PROPLOCATIONS_20140228.JPG">
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT;BORDER-TOP:1PT NONE #D9D9D9 ;BORDER-BOTTOM:1PT NONE #D9D9D9 ;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;TEXT-JUSTIFY:INTER-IDEOGRAPH;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN,TIMES,SERIF;FONT-SIZE: 11PT;">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	&nbsp;

<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT;BORDER-TOP:1PT NONE #D9D9D9 ;BORDER-BOTTOM:1PT NONE #D9D9D9 ;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;TEXT-JUSTIFY:INTER-IDEOGRAPH;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN,TIMES,SERIF;FONT-SIZE: 11PT;">

<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT;BORDER-TOP:1PT NONE #D9D9D9 ;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;TEXT-JUSTIFY:INTER-IDEOGRAPH;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN,TIMES,SERIF;FONT-SIZE: 11PT;">

	&nbsp;

</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT;TEXT-DECORATION:UNDERLINE;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN,TIMES,SERIF;FONT-SIZE: 11PT;">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;FONT-WEIGHT:BOLD;">
</FONT>
</P>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-LEFT:10.2941176470588%;MARGIN-RIGHT:10.2941176470588%;">
<P>
<FONT SIZE="1">
</FONT>
</P>
<DIV STYLE="WIDTH:100%">
<P STYLE="MARGIN:24PT 0PT 0PT;TEXT-ALIGN:CENTER;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN,TIMES,SERIF;FONT-SIZE: 11PT;">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	11
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
</FONT>
</P>
</DIV>

<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-LEFT:10.2941176470588%;MARGIN-RIGHT:10.2941176470588%;">
<HR ALIGN="CENTER" STYLE='BACKGROUND-COLOR:#000000; BORDER-WIDTH:0; COLOR:#000000; HEIGHT:2PT; LINEHEIGHT:0; WIDTH:100%;'>
</HR>
<P STYLE="PAGE-BREAK-AFTER:ALWAYS">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<A NAME="eolPage12"></A>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-LEFT:10.2941176470588%;MARGIN-RIGHT:10.2941176470588%;">
<DIV STYLE="WIDTH:100%">
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT 0PT 30PT;COLOR:#0563C1;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN,TIMES,SERIF;FONT-SIZE: 10PT;">
<A HREF="#URG-20151231X10K_HTM_TOC">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;COLOR:#0563C1;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	Table of Contents
</FONT>
</A>
</P>
</DIV>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-LEFT:10.2941176470588%;MARGIN-RIGHT:10.2941176470588%;">
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT;TEXT-DECORATION:UNDERLINE;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN,TIMES,SERIF;FONT-SIZE: 11PT;">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;FONT-WEIGHT:BOLD;">
	Operating Properties
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN,TIMES,SERIF;FONT-SIZE: 11PT;">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT;TEXT-INDENT:36PT;TEXT-DECORATION:NONE;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN,TIMES,SERIF;FONT-SIZE: 11PT;">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;FONT-WEIGHT:BOLD;FONT-STYLE:ITALIC;TEXT-DECORATION:NONE;">
	Lost Creek Project &#x2013; Great Divide Basin, Wyoming
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN,TIMES,SERIF;FONT-SIZE: 11PT;">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT;BORDER-BOTTOM:1PT NONE #D9D9D9 ;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;TEXT-JUSTIFY:INTER-IDEOGRAPH;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN,TIMES,SERIF;FONT-SIZE: 11PT;">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	The Lost Creek Project area was acquired in 2005, and is located in the Great Divide Basin, Wyoming. The
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	M
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	ain
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	M
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	ineral
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	T
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	rend of the Lost Creek uranium deposit (the &#x201C;MMT&#x201D;) is located within the Lost Creek Project. The permit area of the Lost Creek Project covers 4,254 acres (1,722 hectares), comprising 201 lode mining claims and one State of Wyoming mineral lease section. Regional access relies almost exclusively on existing public roads and highways. The local and regional transportation network consists of primary, secondary, local and unimproved roads. Direct access to Lost Creek is mainly on two crown-and-ditched gravel paved access roads to the processing plant. One road enters from the west off of Sweetwater County Road 23N (Wamsutter-Crooks Gap Road); the other enters from the east off of
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	U.S. Bureau of Land Management (&#x201C;
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	BLM
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	&#x201D;)
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	Sooner Road. On a wider basis, from population centers, the Property area is served by an Interstate Highway (Interstate 80), a US Highway (US 287), Wyoming state routes (SR 220 and 73 to Bairoil), local county roads, and BLM roads. The Lost Creek Property is located as shown here:
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT;BORDER-TOP:1PT NONE #D9D9D9 ;BORDER-BOTTOM:1PT NONE #D9D9D9 ;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;TEXT-JUSTIFY:INTER-IDEOGRAPH;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN,TIMES,SERIF;FONT-SIZE: 11PT;">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT;TEXT-ALIGN:CENTER;BORDER-TOP:1PT NONE #D9D9D9 ;BORDER-BOTTOM:1PT NONE #D9D9D9 ;TEXT-JUSTIFY:INTER-IDEOGRAPH;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN,TIMES,SERIF;FONT-SIZE: 11PT;">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
<IMG SRC="http://content.edgar-online.com/edgar_conv_img/2016/02/26/0001558370-16-003622_URG20151231X10K003.JPG" STYLE="WIDTH: 6.75IN; HEIGHT: 5.215972IN" ALT="PICTURE 5">
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT;BORDER-TOP:1PT NONE #D9D9D9 ;BORDER-BOTTOM:1PT NONE #D9D9D9 ;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;TEXT-JUSTIFY:INTER-IDEOGRAPH;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN,TIMES,SERIF;FONT-SIZE: 11PT;">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT;BORDER-TOP:1PT NONE #D9D9D9 ;BORDER-BOTTOM:1PT NONE #D9D9D9 ;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;TEXT-JUSTIFY:INTER-IDEOGRAPH;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN,TIMES,SERIF;FONT-SIZE: 11PT;">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	The basic infrastructure (power, water, and transportation) necessary to support our ISR operation is located within reasonable proximity.&nbsp;&nbsp;Generally, the proximity of Lost Creek to paved roads is beneficial with respect to transportation of equipment, supplies, personnel and product to and from the property. Existing regional
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
</FONT>
</P>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-LEFT:10.2941176470588%;MARGIN-RIGHT:10.2941176470588%;">
<P>
<FONT SIZE="1">
</FONT>
</P>
<DIV STYLE="WIDTH:100%">
<P STYLE="MARGIN:24PT 0PT 0PT;TEXT-ALIGN:CENTER;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN,TIMES,SERIF;FONT-SIZE: 11PT;">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	12
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
</FONT>
</P>
</DIV>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-LEFT:10.2941176470588%;MARGIN-RIGHT:10.2941176470588%;">
<HR ALIGN="CENTER" STYLE='BACKGROUND-COLOR:#000000; BORDER-WIDTH:0; COLOR:#000000; HEIGHT:2PT; LINEHEIGHT:0; WIDTH:100%;'>
</HR>
<P STYLE="PAGE-BREAK-AFTER:ALWAYS">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<A NAME="eolPage13"></A>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-LEFT:10.2941176470588%;MARGIN-RIGHT:10.2941176470588%;">
<DIV STYLE="WIDTH:100%">
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT 0PT 30PT;COLOR:#0563C1;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN,TIMES,SERIF;FONT-SIZE: 10PT;">
<A HREF="#URG-20151231X10K_HTM_TOC">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;COLOR:#0563C1;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	Table of Contents
</FONT>
</A>
</P>
</DIV>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-LEFT:10.2941176470588%;MARGIN-RIGHT:10.2941176470588%;">
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT;BORDER-TOP:1PT NONE #D9D9D9 ;BORDER-BOTTOM:1PT NONE #D9D9D9 ;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;TEXT-JUSTIFY:INTER-IDEOGRAPH;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN,TIMES,SERIF;FONT-SIZE: 11PT;">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	overhead electrical service is aligned in a north-to-south direction along the western boundary of the Lost Creek Project.
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	A new overhead power line, approximately
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	two
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	miles in length, was constructed to bring power from the existing Pacific Power line to the Lost Creek plant.
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	Power drops have been made to the property and distributed to the plant, offices, wellfields, and other facilities.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT;BORDER-TOP:1PT NONE #D9D9D9 ;BORDER-BOTTOM:1PT NONE #D9D9D9 ;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;TEXT-JUSTIFY:INTER-IDEOGRAPH;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN,TIMES,SERIF;FONT-SIZE: 11PT;">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT;BORDER-TOP:1PT NONE #D9D9D9 ;BORDER-BOTTOM:1PT NONE #D9D9D9 ;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;TEXT-JUSTIFY:INTER-IDEOGRAPH;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN,TIMES,SERIF;FONT-SIZE: 11PT;">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	Following the
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	purchase of an existing production royalty with respect to 20 claims of the Lost Creek Project in 2013, there are no remaining royalties at the Lost Creek Project, except for the royalty on the State of Wyoming section mineral lease as provided by law. Currently, there is only limited production planned from the State lease section. There is a production royalty of one percent on certain claims of the LC East Project, and other royalties on other claims within the other adjoining projects
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	(LC South and EN projects)
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	as well as the other State sections on which we maintain mineral leases (LC West and EN projects).
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT;BORDER-TOP:1PT NONE #D9D9D9 ;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;TEXT-JUSTIFY:INTER-IDEOGRAPH;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN,TIMES,SERIF;FONT-SIZE: 11PT;">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN,TIMES,SERIF;FONT-SIZE: 11PT;">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;FONT-STYLE:ITALIC;">
	Production Operations
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;TEXT-JUSTIFY:INTER-IDEOGRAPH;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN,TIMES,SERIF;FONT-SIZE: 11PT;">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;TEXT-JUSTIFY:INTER-IDEOGRAPH;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN,TIMES,SERIF;FONT-SIZE: 11PT;">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	Following receipt of the final regulatory authorization in October
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	2012
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	, we commenced construction at Lost Creek. Construction included the plant facility and office building, installation of all process equipment, installation of two access roads, additional power lines and drop lines
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	, deep disposal wells, construction of two holding ponds, warehouse building, and drill
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	shed building.&nbsp;&nbsp;In August 2013 we were given operational approval by the NRC and commenced production operation activities.
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	See also discussion of the operational methods used at Lost Creek, above, under heading
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;FONT-STYLE:ITALIC;">
	&#x201C;Business and Properties
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;FONT-STYLE:ITALIC;">
	.
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;FONT-STYLE:ITALIC;">
	&#x201D; &nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;TEXT-JUSTIFY:INTER-IDEOGRAPH;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN,TIMES,SERIF;FONT-SIZE: 11PT;">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT 0PT 6PT;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;TEXT-JUSTIFY:INTER-IDEOGRAPH;BORDER-BOTTOM:1PT NONE #D9D9D9 ;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN,TIMES,SERIF;FONT-SIZE: 11PT;">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	For the Lost Creek PEA, in order to accurately reflect existing resources, all resources produced through September 30, 2015 (1,358,407 pounds) were subtracted from total Measured Resources from the HJ Horizon in MU1. All the wells to support the originally-planned 13 header houses (&#x201C;HHs&#x201D;) have been completed. Surface installations for HHs 1-1 through 1-12 have been installed and HHs 1-1 through 1-11 were operational as of October 15, 2015. Header house 12 was brought online in November. Construction of header house 13 is underway.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT 0PT 6PT;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;TEXT-JUSTIFY:INTER-IDEOGRAPH;BORDER-TOP:1PT NONE #D9D9D9 ;BORDER-BOTTOM:1PT NONE #D9D9D9 ;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN,TIMES,SERIF;FONT-SIZE: 11PT;">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	All monitor ring wells have been installed and pump-tested in MU2. As of October 15, 2015,
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	the effective date for the Lost Creek PEA,
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	138 pattern wells have been piloted within HHs 2-1, 2-2 and 2-3
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	(at December 31, 2015, 179 pattern wells were piloted)
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	. Additionally, two applications for amendments to the license and permits have been submitted
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	. T
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	he two applications seek to authorize production in the KM Horizon within the Lost Creek Project and to authorize production in the HJ and KM Horizons within the EMT in the LC East Project.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT 0PT 6PT;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;TEXT-JUSTIFY:INTER-IDEOGRAPH;BORDER-TOP:1PT NONE #D9D9D9 ;BORDER-BOTTOM:1PT NONE #D9D9D9 ;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN,TIMES,SERIF;FONT-SIZE: 11PT;">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	During 2015,
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	783,54
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	7
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	pounds of U
</FONT>
<SUB STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	3
</SUB>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	O
</FONT>
<SUB STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	8
</SUB>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	were captured
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	within the Lost Creek plant; 727,24
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	5
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	pounds U
</FONT>
<SUB STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	3
</SUB>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	O
</FONT>
<SUB STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	8 &nbsp;
</SUB>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	were packaged in drums; and 717,125 pounds U
</FONT>
<SUB STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	3
</SUB>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	O
</FONT>
<SUB STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	8 &nbsp;
</SUB>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	of drummed inventory were shipped from the Lost Creek processing plant to the converter. At December 31, inventory at the conversion facility was approximately
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	63,776
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	pounds U
</FONT>
<SUB STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	3
</SUB>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	O
</FONT>
<SUB STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	8
</SUB>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	.&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT 0PT 6PT;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;TEXT-JUSTIFY:INTER-IDEOGRAPH;BORDER-TOP:1PT NONE #D9D9D9 ;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN,TIMES,SERIF;FONT-SIZE: 11PT;">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	From production, Lost Creek sold 725,000 pounds U
</FONT>
<SUB STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	3
</SUB>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	O
</FONT>
<SUB STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	8 &nbsp;
</SUB>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	during calendar 2015 at an average price of US$41.33 per pound. Total sales for 2015, including purchased U
</FONT>
<SUB STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	3
</SUB>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	O
</FONT>
<SUB STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	8
</SUB>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	, was 925,000 pounds at an average price of US$45.20 per pound. Contract sales were as expected (630,000 pounds at an average price of US$49.42 per pound); however, spot sales were lower than expected (295,000 pounds at an average price of US$36.18) due to the continuing low spot price environment.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;TEXT-JUSTIFY:INTER-IDEOGRAPH;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN,TIMES,SERIF;FONT-SIZE: 11PT;">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	After more than two years of operations, the 2015 average plant head grade remained at 97 ppm despite having somewhat lower head grades for the fourth quarter. Head grade during December was 87 ppm, which was above the quarter&#x2019;s average grade of 85 ppm. The lower head grade during this period of operation, as well as varying month-to-month grades, is a typical result as the mine matures and older operating patterns remain in the flow regime while newer patterns are brought online. This maturation of mine is also demonstrated through the increasing average flowrates, with a 454 gpm (23.5%) increase quarter-over-quarter.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;TEXT-JUSTIFY:INTER-IDEOGRAPH;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN,TIMES,SERIF;FONT-SIZE: 11PT;">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
</FONT>
</P>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-LEFT:10.2941176470588%;MARGIN-RIGHT:10.2941176470588%;">
<P>
<FONT SIZE="1">
</FONT>
</P>
<DIV STYLE="WIDTH:100%">
<P STYLE="MARGIN:24PT 0PT 0PT;TEXT-ALIGN:CENTER;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN,TIMES,SERIF;FONT-SIZE: 11PT;">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	13
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
</FONT>
</P>
</DIV>

<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-LEFT:10.2941176470588%;MARGIN-RIGHT:10.2941176470588%;">

	&nbsp;

<DIV STYLE="WIDTH:100%">
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT 0PT 30PT;COLOR:#0563C1;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN,TIMES,SERIF;FONT-SIZE: 10PT;">
<A HREF="#URG-20151231X10K_HTM_TOC">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;COLOR:#0563C1;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	Table of Contents
</FONT>
</A>
</P>
</DIV>

<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-LEFT:10.2941176470588%;MARGIN-RIGHT:10.2941176470588%;">
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;TEXT-JUSTIFY:INTER-IDEOGRAPH;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN,TIMES,SERIF;FONT-SIZE: 11PT;">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;TEXT-JUSTIFY:INTER-IDEOGRAPH;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN,TIMES,SERIF;FONT-SIZE: 11PT;">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;FONT-STYLE:ITALIC;">
	Updated Preliminary Economic Assessment for Lost Creek Property
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;TEXT-JUSTIFY:INTER-IDEOGRAPH;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN,TIMES,SERIF;FONT-SIZE: 11PT;">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;TEXT-JUSTIFY:INTER-IDEOGRAPH;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN,TIMES,SERIF;FONT-SIZE: 11PT;">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	In January 2016
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	, we issued an updated Preliminary Economic Assessment for the Lost Creek Property Sweetwater County Wyoming (
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	January 19, 2016
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	(TREC, Inc.))
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	, which was then amended February 8, 2016 to include two additional tables to supplement the Cash Flow and OPEX tables as set forth in the prior document
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	(
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	as amended,
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	the &#x201C;
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	Lost Creek
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	PEA&#x201D;).
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	The Lost Creek PEA was prepared for the Company and its subsidiary, Lost Creek ISR, LLC, by Douglass H. Graves, P.E., TREC, Inc. (&#x201C;TREC&#x201D;) and James A. Bonner, C.P.G., Vice President Geology of the Company in accordance with NI 43-101.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;TEXT-JUSTIFY:INTER-IDEOGRAPH;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN,TIMES,SERIF;FONT-SIZE: 11PT;">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN,TIMES,SERIF;FONT-SIZE: 11PT;">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	According to the Lost Creek PEA, the current mineral resources at the Lost Creek Property are as follows:
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN,TIMES,SERIF;FONT-SIZE: 11PT;">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN,TIMES,SERIF;FONT-SIZE: 11PT;">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	Lost Creek Property - Resource Summary
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN,TIMES,SERIF;FONT-SIZE: 11PT;">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>

<EFX_UNIDENTIFIED_TABLE>
<TR>
<TD VALIGN="MIDDLE" STYLE="WIDTH:10.00%;BORDER-TOP:1PT NONE #D9D9D9 ;BORDER-LEFT:1PT NONE #D9D9D9 ;BORDER-BOTTOM:1.5PT SOLID #808080 ;BORDER-RIGHT:1PT SOLID #808080 ;BACKGROUND-COLOR: #AUTO;PADDING:0PT;">
<A NAME="FIS_UNIDENTIFIED_TABLE_7"></A>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT;TEXT-ALIGN:CENTER;COLOR:#000000;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN,TIMES,SERIF;FONT-SIZE: 8PT;">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;FONT-SIZE:8PT;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>

<TD ALIGN="LEFT" VALIGN="TOP">

</P>
</TD>
<TD VALIGN="TOP" ALIGN="LEFT" STYLE="WIDTH: 18.00PT; DISPLAY: INLINE;">
<P STYLE="BORDER-TOP:1PT NONE #D9D9D9 ;BORDER-BOTTOM:1PT NONE #D9D9D9 ;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;TEXT-JUSTIFY:INTER-IDEOGRAPH;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN,TIMES,SERIF;FONT-SIZE: 11PT;MARGIN:0PT;">
<FONT STYLE="MARGIN:0PT;BORDER-TOP:1PT NONE #D9D9D9;BORDER-BOTTOM:1PT NONE #D9D9D9;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;TEXT-JUSTIFY:INTER-IDEOGRAPH;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN,TIMES,SERIF;FONT-SIZE:11PT;;">
	2.

</TD>
<TD STYLE="WIDTH:0PT;">
<P STYLE="WIDTH:0PT;WIDTH:0PT;FONT-SIZE:0PT;">
</P>
</TD>
<TD ALIGN="LEFT" VALIGN="TOP">
<P STYLE="BORDER-TOP:1PT NONE #D9D9D9 ;BORDER-BOTTOM:1PT NONE #D9D9D9 ;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;TEXT-JUSTIFY:INTER-IDEOGRAPH;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN,TIMES,SERIF;FONT-SIZE: 11PT;MARGIN:0PT;">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;COLOR:#000000;">
	% eU
</FONT>
<SUB STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;COLOR:#000000;">
	3
</SUB>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;COLOR:#000000;">
	O
</FONT>
<SUB STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;COLOR:#000000;">
	8
</SUB>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;COLOR:#000000;">
	is a measure of gamma intensity from a decay product of uranium and is not a direct measurement of uranium. Numerous comparisons of eU
</FONT>
<SUB STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;COLOR:#000000;">
	3
</SUB>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;COLOR:#000000;">
	O
</FONT>
<SUB STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;COLOR:#000000;">
	8
</SUB>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;COLOR:#000000;">
	and chemical assays of Lost Creek rock samples, as well as PFN logging, indicate that eU
</FONT>
<SUB STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;COLOR:#000000;">
	3
</SUB>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;COLOR:#000000;">
	O
</FONT>
<SUB STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;COLOR:#000000;">
	8
</SUB>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;COLOR:#000000;">
	is a reasonable indicator of the chemical concentration of uranium.
</FONT>
</P>
</TD>
</TR>

	above.
