<DIV STYLE="WIDTH:100%">
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT 0PT 30PT;COLOR:#0563C1;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN,TIMES,SERIF;FONT-SIZE: 10PT;">
<A HREF="#URG-20151231X10K_HTM_TOC">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;COLOR:#0563C1;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	Table of Contents
</FONT>
</A>
</P>
</DIV>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-LEFT:10.2941176470588%;MARGIN-RIGHT:10.2941176470588%;">
<DIV STYLE="WIDTH:100%">
<TABLE STYLE="WIDTH:100%;" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0">
<TR>
<TD STYLE="WIDTH:0PT;">
<P STYLE="WIDTH:0PT;FONT-SIZE:0PT;">
</P>
</TD>
<TD VALIGN="TOP" ALIGN="LEFT" STYLE="WIDTH: 18.00PT; DISPLAY: INLINE;">
<P STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;TEXT-JUSTIFY:INTER-IDEOGRAPH;BORDER-TOP:1PT NONE #D9D9D9 ;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN,TIMES,SERIF;FONT-SIZE: 11PT;MARGIN:0PT;">
<FONT STYLE="MARGIN:0PT;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;TEXT-JUSTIFY:INTER-IDEOGRAPH;BORDER-TOP:1PT NONE #D9D9D9;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN,TIMES,SERIF;FONT-SIZE:11PT;;">
	2.
</FONT>
</P>
</TD>
<TD STYLE="WIDTH:0PT;">
<P STYLE="WIDTH:0PT;WIDTH:0PT;FONT-SIZE:0PT;">
</P>
</TD>
<TD ALIGN="LEFT" VALIGN="TOP">
<P STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;TEXT-JUSTIFY:INTER-IDEOGRAPH;BORDER-TOP:1PT NONE #D9D9D9 ;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN,TIMES,SERIF;FONT-SIZE: 11PT;MARGIN:0PT;">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;COLOR:#000000;">
	Costs of sales include all production costs (notes 1, 2, 3 and 4 in the previous Production Costs table) adjusted for changes in inventory values.
</FONT>
</P>
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
</DIV>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;TEXT-JUSTIFY:INTER-IDEOGRAPH;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN,TIMES,SERIF;FONT-SIZE: 11PT;">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;TEXT-JUSTIFY:INTER-IDEOGRAPH;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN,TIMES,SERIF;FONT-SIZE: 11PT;">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	U
</FONT>
<SUB STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	3
</SUB>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	O
</FONT>
<SUB STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	8
</SUB>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	sales in 2015 Q4 were based on selling 225,000 pounds at an average price per pound of $34.47. The lower average price, as compared to previous quarters, was due to not having any deliveries into higher priced contracts during the quarter. In 2015 Q4, we had only one 50,000 pound contract delivery into our lowest priced contract of the year and we sold 175,000 pounds on the spot market, which was persistently low throughout the year.&nbsp;&nbsp;For the year, we sold 925,000 pounds at an average price per pound of $45.20 for total uranium sales of $41.8 million.&nbsp;&nbsp;Total 2015 contract deliveries were 630,000 pounds at an average price per pound of $49.42.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;TEXT-JUSTIFY:INTER-IDEOGRAPH;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN,TIMES,SERIF;FONT-SIZE: 11PT;">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;TEXT-JUSTIFY:INTER-IDEOGRAPH;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN,TIMES,SERIF;FONT-SIZE: 11PT;">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	In 2015 Q4, our cost of sales totaled $5.9 million based on selling 225,000 pounds from production at an average cost per pound of $26.36, down from $27.87 in the previous quarter, reflecting the overall lower production cost per pound we achieved throughout the year.&nbsp;&nbsp;As stated before, our cost per pound sold will tend to decrease as our production and sales levels increase, so long as our production costs remained relatively stable, which was the case. For the year, our average cost per pound sold decreased from $36.91 in 2015 Q1 to $26.36 in 2015 Q4. As production levels stabilize, we would expect the cost per pound sold to stabilize as well.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;TEXT-JUSTIFY:INTER-IDEOGRAPH;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN,TIMES,SERIF;FONT-SIZE: 11PT;">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;TEXT-JUSTIFY:INTER-IDEOGRAPH;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN,TIMES,SERIF;FONT-SIZE: 11PT;">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	The gross profit from uranium sales for 2015 Q4 was $1.8 million, which represents a gross profit margin of approximately 24%. This was lower than previous quarters due to the lower sales prices during the quarter, which more than offset the lower cost per pound sold that we achieved.&nbsp;&nbsp;For the year, the gross profit from uranium sales was $12.5 million and the average gross profit margin was 30%.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;TEXT-JUSTIFY:INTER-IDEOGRAPH;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN,TIMES,SERIF;FONT-SIZE: 11PT;">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;TEXT-JUSTIFY:INTER-IDEOGRAPH;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN,TIMES,SERIF;FONT-SIZE: 11PT;">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	At the end of the year, we had approximately 63,776 pounds of U
</FONT>
<SUB STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	3
</SUB>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	O
</FONT>
<SUB STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	8
</SUB>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	at the conversion facility at an average cost per pound of $25.23. The following table shows the average cost per pound of the conversion facility pounds.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;TEXT-JUSTIFY:INTER-IDEOGRAPH;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN,TIMES,SERIF;FONT-SIZE: 11PT;">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<EFX_UNIDENTIFIED_TABLE>
<A NAME="FIS_UNIDENTIFIED_TABLE_19"></A>
<DIV STYLE="WIDTH:100%;">
<TABLE CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0" ALIGN="CENTER" STYLE="BORDER-COLLAPSE:COLLAPSE;WIDTH: 80.00%;MARGIN-LEFT:0PT;">

<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-LEFT:10.2941176470588%;MARGIN-RIGHT:10.2941176470588%;">
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN,TIMES,SERIF;FONT-SIZE: 11PT;">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	Note
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	s
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	:
</FONT>
</P>
<DIV STYLE="WIDTH:100%">
<TABLE STYLE="WIDTH:100%;" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0">
<TR>
<TD STYLE="WIDTH:0PT;">
<P STYLE="WIDTH:0PT;FONT-SIZE:0PT;">
</P>
</TD>
<TD VALIGN="TOP" ALIGN="LEFT" STYLE="WIDTH: 18.00PT; DISPLAY: INLINE;">
<P STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;TEXT-JUSTIFY:INTER-IDEOGRAPH;BORDER-BOTTOM:1PT NONE #D9D9D9 ;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN,TIMES,SERIF;FONT-SIZE: 11PT;MARGIN:0PT;">
<FONT STYLE="MARGIN:0PT;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;TEXT-JUSTIFY:INTER-IDEOGRAPH;BORDER-BOTTOM:1PT NONE #D9D9D9;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN,TIMES,SERIF;FONT-SIZE:11PT;;">
	1.
</FONT>
</P>
</TD>
<TD STYLE="WIDTH:0PT;">
<P STYLE="WIDTH:0PT;WIDTH:0PT;FONT-SIZE:0PT;">
</P>
</TD>
<TD ALIGN="LEFT" VALIGN="TOP">
<P STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;TEXT-JUSTIFY:INTER-IDEOGRAPH;BORDER-BOTTOM:1PT NONE #D9D9D9 ;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN,TIMES,SERIF;FONT-SIZE: 11PT;MARGIN:0PT;">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;COLOR:#000000;">
	For the year 2013, severance and ad valorem taxes were reported as direct reductions of sales as opposed to an element of inventory and cost of sales.&nbsp;&nbsp;The above figures for 2013 have been modified to include the taxes in cost of sales and reflect sales at the gross amount for comparability to 2015 and 2014
</FONT>
</P>
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="WIDTH:100%">
<TABLE STYLE="WIDTH:100%;" CELLPADDING="0" CELLSPACING="0">
<TR>
<TD STYLE="WIDTH:0PT;">
<P STYLE="WIDTH:0PT;FONT-SIZE:0PT;">
</P>
</TD>
<TD VALIGN="TOP" ALIGN="LEFT" STYLE="WIDTH: 18.00PT; DISPLAY: INLINE;">
<P STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;TEXT-JUSTIFY:INTER-IDEOGRAPH;BORDER-TOP:1PT NONE #D9D9D9 ;BORDER-BOTTOM:1PT NONE #D9D9D9 ;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN,TIMES,SERIF;FONT-SIZE: 11PT;MARGIN:0PT;">
<FONT STYLE="MARGIN:0PT;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;TEXT-JUSTIFY:INTER-IDEOGRAPH;BORDER-TOP:1PT NONE #D9D9D9;BORDER-BOTTOM:1PT NONE #D9D9D9;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN,TIMES,SERIF;FONT-SIZE:11PT;;">
	2.
</FONT>
</P>
</TD>
<TD STYLE="WIDTH:0PT;">
<P STYLE="WIDTH:0PT;WIDTH:0PT;FONT-SIZE:0PT;">
</P>
</TD>
<TD ALIGN="LEFT" VALIGN="TOP">
<P STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;TEXT-JUSTIFY:INTER-IDEOGRAPH;BORDER-TOP:1PT NONE #D9D9D9 ;BORDER-BOTTOM:1PT NONE #D9D9D9 ;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN,TIMES,SERIF;FONT-SIZE: 11PT;MARGIN:0PT;">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;COLOR:#000000;">
	Gross profit per pound for the years 2014 and 2013 have been adjusted to be consistent with 2015 presentation.&nbsp;&nbsp;We have eliminated the profit recognized on the assignment of deliveries in calculating gross profit per pound sold for the above comparison.
</FONT>
</P>
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
</DIV>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT 0PT 0PT 36PT;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;TEXT-JUSTIFY:INTER-IDEOGRAPH;BORDER-TOP:1PT NONE #D9D9D9 ;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN,TIMES,SERIF;FONT-SIZE: 11PT;">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;TEXT-JUSTIFY:INTER-IDEOGRAPH;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN,TIMES,SERIF;FONT-SIZE: 11PT;">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	The volume of pounds captured, drummed and shipped has steadily increased as issues associated with the start-up of operations have been addressed and remediated. Similarly, the cash cost and non-cash costs have continued to decrease on a per pound basis as most of our operating expenses are fixed so greater production continues to lead to lower costs per pound. The sole exception is ad valorem and sales costs which are based on industry factors and tax rates determined by the state as well as the average sales price we receive for the sale of U
</FONT>
<SUB STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	3
</SUB>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	O
</FONT>
<SUB STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	8
</SUB>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	. In 2014, the state changed the industry factor for extraction, then subsequently revised it to a lower amount in early 2015. As a result, the rate has varied between years, but should begin to stabilize as the industry factor is set for several years but may still vary due to changes in the average sales prices received.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;TEXT-JUSTIFY:INTER-IDEOGRAPH;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN,TIMES,SERIF;FONT-SIZE: 11PT;">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;TEXT-JUSTIFY:INTER-IDEOGRAPH;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN,TIMES,SERIF;FONT-SIZE: 11PT;">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	As discussed previously, we are con
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	tinuously
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	surveying the market for the opportunity to create future contracts at more favorable rates. In 2013, we only had one contract sale at a very favorable price.&nbsp;&nbsp;2014 and 2015 contract prices averaged $50 per pound, which was what we had targeted.&nbsp;&nbsp;However, in 2015 we also made spot sales into a weaker market which resulted in a reduction of our average sales price as well as our
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	average
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	gross profit
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	per pound
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	despite reducing our per pound costs.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;TEXT-JUSTIFY:INTER-IDEOGRAPH;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN,TIMES,SERIF;FONT-SIZE: 11PT;">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;TEXT-JUSTIFY:INTER-IDEOGRAPH;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN,TIMES,SERIF;FONT-SIZE: 11PT;">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;FONT-STYLE:ITALIC;">
	US GAAP Reconciliation
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;TEXT-JUSTIFY:INTER-IDEOGRAPH;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN,TIMES,SERIF;FONT-SIZE: 11PT;">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;TEXT-JUSTIFY:INTER-IDEOGRAPH;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN,TIMES,SERIF;FONT-SIZE: 11PT;">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	As discussed above, the cash costs, non-cash costs and per pound calculations are non-US GAAP measures we use to assess business performance.
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	To facilitate a better understanding of these measures, the tables below present a reconciliation of these measures to the financial results as presented in our financial statements.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;TEXT-JUSTIFY:INTER-IDEOGRAPH;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN,TIMES,SERIF;FONT-SIZE: 11PT;">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>

<TD VALIGN="BOTTOM" STYLE="WIDTH:01.72%;BORDER-TOP:1PT NONE #D9D9D9 ;BORDER-LEFT:1PT NONE #D9D9D9 ;BORDER-RIGHT:1PT NONE #D9D9D9 ;BACKGROUND-COLOR: #AUTO;PADDING:0PT;">

<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;TEXT-JUSTIFY:INTER-IDEOGRAPH;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN,TIMES,SERIF;FONT-SIZE: 11PT;">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	The Company delivers U
</FONT>
<SUB STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	3
</SUB>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	O
</FONT>
<SUB STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	8
</SUB>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	to a conversion facility and receives credit for a specified quantity measured in pounds once the product is confirmed to meet the required specifications. When a delivery is approved, the Company notifies the conversion facility with instruction for a title transfer to the customer. Revenue is recognized once a title transfer of the U
</FONT>
<SUB STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	3
</SUB>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	O
</FONT>
<SUB STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	8
</SUB>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	is confirmed by the conversion facility.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;TEXT-JUSTIFY:INTER-IDEOGRAPH;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN,TIMES,SERIF;FONT-SIZE: 11PT;">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;TEXT-JUSTIFY:INTER-IDEOGRAPH;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN,TIMES,SERIF;FONT-SIZE: 11PT;">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	U
</FONT>
<SUB STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	3
</SUB>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	O
</FONT>
<SUB STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	8
</SUB>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	sales of $41.8 million for the year were based on selling 925,000 pounds at an average price of $45.20, which resulted from meeting all of our contractual delivery requirements (630,000 pounds at an average price

<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;TEXT-JUSTIFY:INTER-IDEOGRAPH;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN,TIMES,SERIF;FONT-SIZE: 11PT;">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	of $49.42 per pound) combined with additional spot sales (295,000 pounds at an average price of $36.18 per pound). Additionally, we recognized $0.1 million of disposal fees at the Shirley Basin Project. This resulted in total sales of $41.9 million as reported in the financial statements.
</FONT>
</P>

<TD VALIGN="TOP" ALIGN="LEFT" STYLE="WIDTH: 18.00PT; DISPLAY: INLINE;">
<P STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;TEXT-JUSTIFY:INTER-IDEOGRAPH;BORDER-BOTTOM:1PT NONE #D9D9D9 ;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN,TIMES,SERIF;FONT-SIZE: 10PT;MARGIN:0PT;">
<FONT STYLE="MARGIN:0PT;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;TEXT-JUSTIFY:INTER-IDEOGRAPH;BORDER-BOTTOM:1PT NONE #D9D9D9;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN,TIMES,SERIF;FONT-SIZE:10PT;;">
	1

<TD STYLE="WIDTH:0PT;">

</P>
</TD>
<TD ALIGN="LEFT" VALIGN="TOP">
<P STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;TEXT-JUSTIFY:INTER-IDEOGRAPH;BORDER-BOTTOM:1PT NONE #D9D9D9 ;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN,TIMES,SERIF;FONT-SIZE: 10PT;MARGIN:0PT;">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;FONT-SIZE:10PT;COLOR:#000000;">
	The cost per pound sold reflects both cash and non-cash costs, which are combined as cost of sales in the statement of operations included in this filing.&nbsp;&nbsp;The cash and non-cash cost components are identified in the above production cost table.
</FONT>
</P>
</TD>

<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT 0PT 0PT 36PT;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;TEXT-JUSTIFY:INTER-IDEOGRAPH;BORDER-TOP:1PT NONE #D9D9D9 ;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN,TIMES,SERIF;FONT-SIZE: 10PT;">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;TEXT-JUSTIFY:INTER-IDEOGRAPH;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN,TIMES,SERIF;FONT-SIZE: 11PT;">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	The cost of sales includes ad valorem and severance taxes related to the extraction of uranium, all costs of wellfield, plant and site operations including the related depreciation and amortization of capitalized assets, reclamation and mineral property costs, plus product distribution costs. These costs are also used to value inventory and the resulting inventoried cost per pound is compared to the estimated sales prices based on the contracts or spot sales anticipated for the distribution of the product. Any costs in excess of the calculated market value are charged to cost of sales.
</FONT>
</P>

<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN,TIMES,SERIF;FONT-SIZE: 11PT;">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN,TIMES,SERIF;FONT-SIZE: 11PT;">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;FONT-WEIGHT:BOLD;TEXT-DECORATION:UNDERLINE;">
	Sales
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN,TIMES,SERIF;FONT-SIZE: 11PT;">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;TEXT-JUSTIFY:INTER-IDEOGRAPH;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN,TIMES,SERIF;FONT-SIZE: 11PT;">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	We sold a total of 925,000 pounds of U
</FONT>
<SUB STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	3
</SUB>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	O
</FONT>
<SUB STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	8
</SUB>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	during the year ended December 31, 2015 for an average price of $45.20 per pound as compared to 2014 when we sold 517,760 pounds for an average price of $51.22. The fluctuation in sales prices relates primarily to lower priced spot sales made in 2015.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;TEXT-JUSTIFY:INTER-IDEOGRAPH;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN,TIMES,SERIF;FONT-SIZE: 11PT;">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;TEXT-JUSTIFY:INTER-IDEOGRAPH;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN,TIMES,SERIF;FONT-SIZE: 11PT;">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	For the year ended December 31, 2015, we recognized $
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	70
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	thousand compared to $323 thousand from disposal fees during 2014.&nbsp;&nbsp;In 2014, we also recognized sales of $2.5 million from deliveries under offtake agreements which had been assigned to a third party during 2013 for cash consideration.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;TEXT-JUSTIFY:INTER-IDEOGRAPH;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN,TIMES,SERIF;FONT-SIZE: 11PT;">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN,TIMES,SERIF;FONT-SIZE: 11PT;">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;FONT-WEIGHT:BOLD;TEXT-DECORATION:UNDERLINE;">
	Cost of Sales
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN,TIMES,SERIF;FONT-SIZE: 11PT;">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;TEXT-JUSTIFY:INTER-IDEOGRAPH;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN,TIMES,SERIF;FONT-SIZE: 11PT;">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	The cost of sales includes all costs of wellfield operations and maintenance, severance and ad valorem taxes, plant operations and maintenance and mine site overhead including depreciation on the related capital assets,
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
</FONT>
</P>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-LEFT:10.2941176470588%;MARGIN-RIGHT:10.2941176470588%;">
<P>
<FONT SIZE="1">
</FONT>
</P>
<DIV STYLE="WIDTH:100%">
<P STYLE="MARGIN:24PT 0PT 0PT;TEXT-ALIGN:CENTER;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN,TIMES,SERIF;FONT-SIZE: 11PT;">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	51
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
</FONT>
</P>
</DIV>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-LEFT:10.2941176470588%;MARGIN-RIGHT:10.2941176470588%;">
<HR ALIGN="CENTER" STYLE='BACKGROUND-COLOR:#000000; BORDER-WIDTH:0; COLOR:#000000; HEIGHT:2PT; LINEHEIGHT:0; WIDTH:100%;'>
</HR>
<P STYLE="PAGE-BREAK-AFTER:ALWAYS">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<A NAME="eolPage52"></A>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-LEFT:10.2941176470588%;MARGIN-RIGHT:10.2941176470588%;">
<DIV STYLE="WIDTH:100%">
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT 0PT 30PT;COLOR:#0563C1;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN,TIMES,SERIF;FONT-SIZE: 10PT;">
<A HREF="#URG-20151231X10K_HTM_TOC">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;COLOR:#0563C1;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	Table of Contents
</FONT>
</A>
</P>
</DIV>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-LEFT:10.2941176470588%;MARGIN-RIGHT:10.2941176470588%;">
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;TEXT-JUSTIFY:INTER-IDEOGRAPH;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN,TIMES,SERIF;FONT-SIZE: 11PT;">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	capitalized reclamation costs and amortization of mineral property costs, the cost of inventory purchased for resale and distribution costs. Wellfield costs, plant costs, site overhead costs and distribution costs are included in inventory and the resulting inventoried cost per pound is compared to the estimated sales prices based on the contracts or spot sales anticipated for the distribution of the product. Any costs in excess of the calculated market value are charged to expense.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;TEXT-JUSTIFY:INTER-IDEOGRAPH;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN,TIMES,SERIF;FONT-SIZE: 11PT;">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;TEXT-JUSTIFY:INTER-IDEOGRAPH;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN,TIMES,SERIF;FONT-SIZE: 11PT;">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	As compared to 2014, our cost per pound sold decreased $2.82 to $31.67 in 2015. The year 2015 includes one sale of purchased product, which was at a cost of $39.39 per pound. Excluding this sale, our year to date cost per pound sold from produced inventory was $29.5
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	3
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	, which represents a decrease from 2014 of $4.95 per pound.&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;TEXT-JUSTIFY:INTER-IDEOGRAPH;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN,TIMES,SERIF;FONT-SIZE: 11PT;">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;TEXT-JUSTIFY:INTER-IDEOGRAPH;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN,TIMES,SERIF;FONT-SIZE: 11PT;">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	The reduction in our cost per pound sold from produced inventory is primarily a function of increased production in 2015 as compared to 2014. As stated in previous filings, most of our production costs are relatively fixed. Therefore increased production yields lower costs per pound which is reflected in our operations during 2015.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;TEXT-JUSTIFY:INTER-IDEOGRAPH;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN,TIMES,SERIF;FONT-SIZE: 11PT;">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;TEXT-JUSTIFY:INTER-IDEOGRAPH;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN,TIMES,SERIF;FONT-SIZE: 11PT;">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;FONT-WEIGHT:BOLD;TEXT-DECORATION:UNDERLINE;">
	Gross Profit
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;TEXT-JUSTIFY:INTER-IDEOGRAPH;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN,TIMES,SERIF;FONT-SIZE: 11PT;">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;TEXT-JUSTIFY:INTER-IDEOGRAPH;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN,TIMES,SERIF;FONT-SIZE: 11PT;">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	The gross profit from uranium sales was $12.5 million for the year ended December 31, 2015, which represents a gross profit margin of approximately 30%.&nbsp;&nbsp;Gross profits of $11.5 million in 2014 included $2.5 million from the delivery of uranium by a third party that related to contractual delivery commitments from 2013. Excluding these deferred revenues, the gross profit from uranium sales was $8.7 million, which represents a gross profit margin of approximately 33%.
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	The primary reason for the decrease in the gross profit margin was the lower-priced spot sales in 2015, which more than offset the decrease in the cost per pound sold.&nbsp;&nbsp;Generally, cost per pound sold declined with the exception of the purchased inventory which was at a higher cost per pound than the cost to produce and therefore also negatively affected the gross profit percentage in 2015.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;TEXT-JUSTIFY:INTER-IDEOGRAPH;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN,TIMES,SERIF;FONT-SIZE: 11PT;">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;TEXT-JUSTIFY:INTER-IDEOGRAPH;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN,TIMES,SERIF;FONT-SIZE: 11PT;">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;FONT-WEIGHT:BOLD;TEXT-DECORATION:UNDERLINE;">
	Operating Expenses
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;TEXT-JUSTIFY:INTER-IDEOGRAPH;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN,TIMES,SERIF;FONT-SIZE: 11PT;">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;TEXT-JUSTIFY:INTER-IDEOGRAPH;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN,TIMES,SERIF;FONT-SIZE: 11PT;">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	Total operating expenses for the year ended December 31, 2015 were $14.4 million. Operating expenses include exploration and evaluation expense, development expense, G&amp;A expense and mineral property write-offs. These expenses decreased by $4.0 million compared to 2014 which included costs associated with developing an additional disposal well and a potential severance liability that was recorded.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;TEXT-JUSTIFY:INTER-IDEOGRAPH;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN,TIMES,SERIF;FONT-SIZE: 11PT;">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;TEXT-JUSTIFY:INTER-IDEOGRAPH;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN,TIMES,SERIF;FONT-SIZE: 11PT;">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	Exploration and evaluation expense consists of labor and the associated costs of the exploration and evaluation departments as well as land holding and exploration costs including drilling and analysis on properties which have not reached the permitting or operations stage. These expenses decreased $0.4 million for the year ended December 31, 2015 compared to 2014. All costs associated with the geology and geological information systems departments as well as the costs incurred on specific projects as described above are reflected in this category. Costs decreased due to a reduction in land lease costs associated with the Mustang property which was abandoned in 2014 and a decrease in labor related costs.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;TEXT-JUSTIFY:INTER-IDEOGRAPH;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN,TIMES,SERIF;FONT-SIZE: 11PT;">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;TEXT-JUSTIFY:INTER-IDEOGRAPH;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN,TIMES,SERIF;FONT-SIZE: 11PT;">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	Development expense includes costs incurred at the Lost Creek Project not directly attributable to production activities, including wellfield construction, drilling and development costs. It also includes costs associated with the Shirley Basin and Lucky Mc properties as they previously reached the permitting stage or operations stage. Development expenses decreased by $2.3 million in the year ended December 31, 2015 compared to 2014.&nbsp;&nbsp;The decrease was primarily related to the cost of a disposal well which was constructed in 2014.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;TEXT-JUSTIFY:INTER-IDEOGRAPH;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN,TIMES,SERIF;FONT-SIZE: 11PT;">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;TEXT-JUSTIFY:INTER-IDEOGRAPH;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN,TIMES,SERIF;FONT-SIZE: 11PT;">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	G&amp;A expense relates to administration, finance, investor relations, land and legal functions and consists principally of personnel, facility and support costs. Expenses decreased by $0.8
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	million
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	for the year ended
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
</FONT>
</P>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-LEFT:10.2941176470588%;MARGIN-RIGHT:10.2941176470588%;">
<P>
<FONT SIZE="1">
</FONT>
</P>
<DIV STYLE="WIDTH:100%">
<P STYLE="MARGIN:24PT 0PT 0PT;TEXT-ALIGN:CENTER;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN,TIMES,SERIF;FONT-SIZE: 11PT;">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	52
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">

<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">

<DIV STYLE="WIDTH:100%">
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT 0PT 30PT;COLOR:#0563C1;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN,TIMES,SERIF;FONT-SIZE: 10PT;">
<A HREF="#URG-20151231X10K_HTM_TOC">

</FONT>

<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-LEFT:10.2941176470588%;MARGIN-RIGHT:10.2941176470588%;">
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;TEXT-JUSTIFY:INTER-IDEOGRAPH;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN,TIMES,SERIF;FONT-SIZE: 11PT;">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	December 31, 2015 compared to 2014. The decrease was due to reduced external consulting and legal expenses of $0.3 million combined with $0.5 million in lower labor costs.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;TEXT-JUSTIFY:INTER-IDEOGRAPH;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN,TIMES,SERIF;FONT-SIZE: 11PT;">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN,TIMES,SERIF;FONT-SIZE: 11PT;">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;FONT-WEIGHT:BOLD;TEXT-DECORATION:UNDERLINE;">
	Other Income and Expenses
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;TEXT-JUSTIFY:INTER-IDEOGRAPH;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN,TIMES,SERIF;FONT-SIZE: 11PT;">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;TEXT-JUSTIFY:INTER-IDEOGRAPH;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN,TIMES,SERIF;FONT-SIZE: 11PT;">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	Net interest expense declined $0.1 million during 2015 compared to the prior year.&nbsp;&nbsp;The decline was primarily due to a reduction in the outstanding principal which was slightly offset by increases in the interest rate on the RMB debt which is tied to the quarterly LIBOR rate.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;TEXT-JUSTIFY:INTER-IDEOGRAPH;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN,TIMES,SERIF;FONT-SIZE: 11PT;">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;TEXT-JUSTIFY:INTER-IDEOGRAPH;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN,TIMES,SERIF;FONT-SIZE: 11PT;">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	In December 2013, the Company sold equity units which included one
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	C
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	ommon
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	S
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	hare and one half warrant for the purchase of stock at US$1.35 per
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	C
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	ommon
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	S
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	hare. As the warrants were priced in U.S. dollars and not Canadian dollars, which is the currency of the Company&#x2019;s
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	Common Shares
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	, these warrants are considered a derivative and are therefore treated as a liability. The gains declined by $0.6 million for the year ended December 31, 2015 compared to 2014 based on changes in the exchange rates and the other factors used in the calculation of Black Scholes valuations which are not directly related to the Company&#x2019;s results of operations.&nbsp;&nbsp;The gain or loss will continue to decline as the warrants near expiry as changes in the exchange rates and a shorter volatility period continue to decrease the total liability.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN,TIMES,SERIF;FONT-SIZE: 11PT;">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;TEXT-JUSTIFY:INTER-IDEOGRAPH;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN,TIMES,SERIF;FONT-SIZE: 11PT;">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;FONT-WEIGHT:BOLD;TEXT-DECORATION:UNDERLINE;">
	Income tax recovery
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;TEXT-JUSTIFY:INTER-IDEOGRAPH;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN,TIMES,SERIF;FONT-SIZE: 11PT;">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;TEXT-JUSTIFY:INTER-IDEOGRAPH;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN,TIMES,SERIF;FONT-SIZE: 11PT;">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	When we acquired Pathfinder in 2013, we recorded a deferred income tax liability as the Pathfinder assets had no
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	tax
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	basis and accounting guidance indicated that the potential liability should be recorded due to Pathfinder not being integrated into our operations and would have a going concern issue as a stand-alone entity.&nbsp;&nbsp;The costs were capitalized as a part of the mineral property acquisition costs and will be amortized for reporting purposes once production commences. The
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	amortization
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	will not be
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	deductible
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	for tax reporting therefore creating a permanent book versus tax difference.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;TEXT-JUSTIFY:INTER-IDEOGRAPH;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN,TIMES,SERIF;FONT-SIZE: 11PT;">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;TEXT-JUSTIFY:INTER-IDEOGRAPH;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN,TIMES,SERIF;FONT-SIZE: 11PT;">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	We did preliminary drilling and baseline testing in 2014,
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	and
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	we filed
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	our
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	permit application with the W
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	DEQ
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	in 2015
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	,
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	therefore demonstrating the intent of incorporating
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	the
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	uranium recovery operations into our other ongoing operations within the next few years pending the approval of the permit
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	application
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	. As Pathfinder is being integrated into
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	our
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	operations, the guidance was no longer applicable and we used a portion of our accumulated net operation losses to offset the liability. The filing of the permit is an indication that the offset will be used within a few years and is therefore more probable than not that it will be used.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;TEXT-JUSTIFY:INTER-IDEOGRAPH;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN,TIMES,SERIF;FONT-SIZE: 11PT;">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;TEXT-JUSTIFY:INTER-IDEOGRAPH;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN,TIMES,SERIF;FONT-SIZE: 11PT;">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;FONT-WEIGHT:BOLD;TEXT-DECORATION:UNDERLINE;">
	Loss per Common Share
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;TEXT-JUSTIFY:INTER-IDEOGRAPH;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN,TIMES,SERIF;FONT-SIZE: 11PT;">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;TEXT-JUSTIFY:INTER-IDEOGRAPH;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN,TIMES,SERIF;FONT-SIZE: 11PT;">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	The basic and diluted losses per
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	C
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	ommon
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	S
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	hare for the year ended December 31, 2015 was $0.0
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	1
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	compared to a loss of $0.07 in 2014. The diluted loss per
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	C
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	ommon
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	S
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	hare is equal to the basic loss per
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	C
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	ommon
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	S
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	hare due to the anti-dilutive effect of all convertible securities outstanding given that net losses were experienced.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT;COLOR:#000000;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN,TIMES,SERIF;FONT-SIZE: 11PT;">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT;COLOR:#000000;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN,TIMES,SERIF;FONT-SIZE: 11PT;">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;FONT-WEIGHT:BOLD;COLOR:#000000;">

</P>

<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN,TIMES,SERIF;FONT-SIZE: 11PT;">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN,TIMES,SERIF;FONT-SIZE: 11PT;">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;FONT-WEIGHT:BOLD;TEXT-DECORATION:UNDERLINE;">
	Sales
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN,TIMES,SERIF;FONT-SIZE: 11PT;">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;TEXT-JUSTIFY:INTER-IDEOGRAPH;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN,TIMES,SERIF;FONT-SIZE: 11PT;">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	We sold a total of 517,760 pounds of U
</FONT>
<SUB STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	3
</SUB>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	O
</FONT>
<SUB STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	8
</SUB>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	in 2014 for an average price of $51.22 per pound as compared to 2013 when we sold 90,000 pounds for an average price of $62.92.&nbsp;&nbsp;All sales for both years were associated with long-term offtake contracts at rates stated within the contracts. Sales revenues in 2013 were reduced by ad valorem and sales taxes of $682 thousand ($7.58 per pound).&nbsp;&nbsp;Effective second quarter 2014, we stopped treating those taxes as a reduction in sales revenues, but rather as a cost of sales as the taxes are based on pounds extracted, not sold. While we applied the adjustment retroactively for purposes of inventory calculations, we elected to treat it as an out-of-period adjustment in that quarter and not restate the prior periods.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;TEXT-JUSTIFY:INTER-IDEOGRAPH;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN,TIMES,SERIF;FONT-SIZE: 11PT;">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;TEXT-JUSTIFY:INTER-IDEOGRAPH;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN,TIMES,SERIF;FONT-SIZE: 11PT;">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	We recognized sales of $2.5 million and $2.6 million for the years 2014 and 2013, respectively, from deliveries under offtake agreements which had been assigned to a third party during 2013 for cash consideration.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;TEXT-JUSTIFY:INTER-IDEOGRAPH;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN,TIMES,SERIF;FONT-SIZE: 11PT;">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;TEXT-JUSTIFY:INTER-IDEOGRAPH;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN,TIMES,SERIF;FONT-SIZE: 11PT;">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	We recognized sales of $323 thousand from disposal fees at the Shirley Basin site in 2014.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;TEXT-JUSTIFY:INTER-IDEOGRAPH;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN,TIMES,SERIF;FONT-SIZE: 11PT;">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	&nbsp;

<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT 0PT 30PT;COLOR:#0563C1;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN,TIMES,SERIF;FONT-SIZE: 10PT;">

<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-LEFT:10.2941176470588%;MARGIN-RIGHT:10.2941176470588%;">
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN,TIMES,SERIF;FONT-SIZE: 11PT;">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;FONT-WEIGHT:BOLD;TEXT-DECORATION:UNDERLINE;">
	Cost of
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;FONT-WEIGHT:BOLD;TEXT-DECORATION:UNDERLINE;">
	sales
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN,TIMES,SERIF;FONT-SIZE: 11PT;">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;TEXT-JUSTIFY:INTER-IDEOGRAPH;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN,TIMES,SERIF;FONT-SIZE: 11PT;">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	The cost of sales includes the wellfield, plant maintenance, site administration and distribution costs associated with the production of U
</FONT>
<SUB STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	3
</SUB>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	O
</FONT>
<SUB STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	8
</SUB>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	adjusted for changes in inventory balances. There were no direct costs of sales associated with either the recognition of the deferred revenue from the sale under the offtake contracts or the disposal fees described above. The increase on cost of sales in 2014 is primarily related to the increase in pounds sold over 2013, as 2013 was our initial year of production and only included one sale of uranium made late in the year.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;TEXT-JUSTIFY:INTER-IDEOGRAPH;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN,TIMES,SERIF;FONT-SIZE: 11PT;">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT;COLOR:#000000;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN,TIMES,SERIF;FONT-SIZE: 11PT;">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;FONT-WEIGHT:BOLD;COLOR:#000000;TEXT-DECORATION:UNDERLINE;">
	Cost per Pound Sold
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT;COLOR:#000000;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN,TIMES,SERIF;FONT-SIZE: 11PT;">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;TEXT-JUSTIFY:INTER-IDEOGRAPH;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN,TIMES,SERIF;FONT-SIZE: 11PT;">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	The cost per pound of U
</FONT>
<SUB STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	3
</SUB>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	O
</FONT>
<SUB STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	8
</SUB>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	sold in 2014 was $34.49 compared to the cost per pound of $34.40 in 2013.&nbsp;&nbsp;Overall the cost per pound actually decreased in 2014 due to increased efficiencies and higher production levels.&nbsp;&nbsp;The reason for the apparent increase was the change in policy to include severance and ad valorem taxes in inventory calculations.&nbsp;&nbsp;A cost per pound of $2.48 was included in the $34.49 cost per pound detailed above in 2014 with no comparable costs in the cost per pound calculation in 2013.&nbsp;&nbsp;Excluding ad valorem and severance taxes, the adjusted 2014 cost per pound was $32.01 as compared to 2013 unadjusted cost per pound of $34.40.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;TEXT-JUSTIFY:INTER-IDEOGRAPH;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN,TIMES,SERIF;FONT-SIZE: 11PT;">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;TEXT-JUSTIFY:INTER-IDEOGRAPH;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN,TIMES,SERIF;FONT-SIZE: 11PT;">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;FONT-WEIGHT:BOLD;TEXT-DECORATION:UNDERLINE;">
	Operating
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;FONT-WEIGHT:BOLD;TEXT-DECORATION:UNDERLINE;">
	Expenses
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;TEXT-JUSTIFY:INTER-IDEOGRAPH;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN,TIMES,SERIF;FONT-SIZE: 11PT;">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;TEXT-JUSTIFY:INTER-IDEOGRAPH;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN,TIMES,SERIF;FONT-SIZE: 11PT;">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	Total
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	operating
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	expenses for the
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	fiscal
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	year ended
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	December 31, 2014
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	were $
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	18.5
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	million which include exploration and evaluation expense, development expense and
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	general &amp; administrative (&#x201C;G&amp;A&#x201D;) expense. These expenses de
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	creased by $
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	9.5&nbsp;
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	million compared to
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	2013, which included costs associated with
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	completing
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	the first
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	disposal wells
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	and
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	preparing the wellfields for production.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;TEXT-JUSTIFY:INTER-IDEOGRAPH;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN,TIMES,SERIF;FONT-SIZE: 11PT;">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;TEXT-JUSTIFY:INTER-IDEOGRAPH;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN,TIMES,SERIF;FONT-SIZE: 11PT;">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	Exploration and evaluation expense consists of labor and
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	the
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	associated costs of the exploration and evaluation departments as well as land holding and exploration costs including drilling and analysis on properties which have not reached the permitting or operations stage. These expenses
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	in
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	creased $0.9&nbsp;
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	million
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	for the year ended
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	December 31, 2014
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	compared to
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	2013
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	.&nbsp;
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	This was primarily due to discontinuing the allocation of labor costs to construction and other development projects.&nbsp;&nbsp;Total cash expenditures for exploration and evaluation were consistent with the prior year.
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	&nbsp;Overall expenditures have been lower in recent years as the focus has been on developing the Lost Creek
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	Project
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	and not on exploration activities. We maintain active geological and evaluation teams, however, who focus on developing
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	our
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	existing
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	properties, such as Shirley Basin,
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	as well as
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	identifying
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	new mineral
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	exploration
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	opportunities.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;TEXT-JUSTIFY:INTER-IDEOGRAPH;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN,TIMES,SERIF;FONT-SIZE: 11PT;">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;TEXT-JUSTIFY:INTER-IDEOGRAPH;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN,TIMES,SERIF;FONT-SIZE: 11PT;">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	Development expense includes costs incurred at the Lost Creek Project prior to the receipt of final regulatory approval in October
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	2013
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	and costs not directly attributable to construction and production activities, including wellfield construction and development costs
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	. Development expenses de
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	creased by $
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	10.8
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	million in
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	2014
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	compared to
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	2013
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	. The most significant cost associated with in
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	situ
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	recovery
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	is the cost of constructing and developing the wellfield header
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	houses, production wells, pipelines within the wellfield and to the plant and related facilities, roads, fencing, powerlines, and disposal wells.
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	O
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	f &nbsp;
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	the cost of
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	wellfield construction
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	, which
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	total
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	ed
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	$15.3 million
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	, $12.0 million
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	was included in
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	development expenses in 2013 as a part of the reclassification of wellfield construction costs as non-capital costs pursuant to SEC Industry Guide 7.&nbsp;&nbsp;The costs in 2014 included continuing costs of adding new header houses and completing wells in the production area as well as the drilling and completion of a third disposal well at a cost of approximately $3.2 million.&nbsp;
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	These costs are considered development costs despit
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	e potential future benefits as we have
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	no proven and probable mineral reserves as defined by CIM Definition Standards and
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	are
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	precluded from capitalizing these expenses under SEC guidance.&nbsp;&nbsp;These costs will continue to be incurred in future years as
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	we
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	expand and develop new wellfields within the Lost Creek and at other projects.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;TEXT-JUSTIFY:INTER-IDEOGRAPH;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN,TIMES,SERIF;FONT-SIZE: 11PT;">

</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;TEXT-JUSTIFY:INTER-IDEOGRAPH;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN,TIMES,SERIF;FONT-SIZE: 11PT;">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	G&amp;A expense relates to
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	corporate
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	administration, finance,
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	taxation,
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	investor
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	and human
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	relations,
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	and the
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	land and legal functions and consists principally of personnel, facilit
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	y and support costs. Expenses in
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	creased $0.
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	9
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	million for the year ended
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	December 31, 2014
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	compared to
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	2013
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	. This is primarily due to
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	an increase in labor costs of $0.3 million, recording a retirement obligation of $0.5 million, and an increase in outside services including accounting, legal and contracted investor relations of $0.3 million
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;TEXT-JUSTIFY:INTER-IDEOGRAPH;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN,TIMES,SERIF;FONT-SIZE: 11PT;">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;TEXT-JUSTIFY:INTER-IDEOGRAPH;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN,TIMES,SERIF;FONT-SIZE: 11PT;">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	W
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	rite off of mineral properties de
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	creased by $
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	0.9
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	million f
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	rom
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	the year
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	2013. In 2014, we wrote off five Canadian properties and royalties totaling $0.5 million.&nbsp;&nbsp;In 2013,
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	we decided to abandon c
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	laims at our South Granite Mountains project in Wyoming and private leases at the Mustang project in Nebraska totaling $1.4 million.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;TEXT-JUSTIFY:INTER-IDEOGRAPH;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN,TIMES,SERIF;FONT-SIZE: 11PT;">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN,TIMES,SERIF;FONT-SIZE: 11PT;">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;FONT-WEIGHT:BOLD;TEXT-DECORATION:UNDERLINE;">
	Other Income and Expenses
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;TEXT-JUSTIFY:INTER-IDEOGRAPH;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN,TIMES,SERIF;FONT-SIZE: 11PT;">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;TEXT-JUSTIFY:INTER-IDEOGRAPH;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN,TIMES,SERIF;FONT-SIZE: 11PT;">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	Interest expense declined by $3.4 million from 2013 to 2014, but this was caused by the
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	write off of loan fees
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	which
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	included the cost of warrants total
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	ing
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	$5.8 million for the year
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	2013
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	issued as a part of the loan consideration to RMB.
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	&nbsp;Excluding that, interest expense would have increased by $3.8 million due to the payment of a full year&#x2019;s worth of interest to Sweetwater County Wyoming on their bond loan and interest payments to RMB.&nbsp;&nbsp;2014 interest payment to RMB were actually lower in total than in 2013, however RMB interest is no longer capitalized as construction period interest and is therefore now included in interest expense.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;TEXT-JUSTIFY:INTER-IDEOGRAPH;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN,TIMES,SERIF;FONT-SIZE: 11PT;">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;TEXT-JUSTIFY:INTER-IDEOGRAPH;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN,TIMES,SERIF;FONT-SIZE: 11PT;">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	As a part of a private placement in December 2013 we issued warrants which were priced in U.S. dollars making them a derivative. This liability is revalued quarterly which resulted in a $0.9 million gain from the reduction of the liability in 2014.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;TEXT-JUSTIFY:INTER-IDEOGRAPH;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN,TIMES,SERIF;FONT-SIZE: 11PT;">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;TEXT-JUSTIFY:INTER-IDEOGRAPH;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN,TIMES,SERIF;FONT-SIZE: 11PT;">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	Write off of investments in
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	2013
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	were $1.0 million as the management of the Bootheel Project venture allowed claims which contained no economic mineralization to lapse on the Bootheel property and all claims at the Buck Point property to lapse. There
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	were no impairments or other write offs of investments in 2014.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;TEXT-JUSTIFY:INTER-IDEOGRAPH;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN,TIMES,SERIF;FONT-SIZE: 11PT;">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">

	S

<A NAME="FIS_LIQUIDITY_CAPITAL"></A>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT;COLOR:#000000;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN,TIMES,SERIF;FONT-SIZE: 11PT;">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;FONT-WEIGHT:BOLD;COLOR:#000000;">
	Material Changes in Financial Condition, Liquidity and Capital Resources
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT;COLOR:#000000;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN,TIMES,SERIF;FONT-SIZE: 11PT;">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;TEXT-JUSTIFY:INTER-IDEOGRAPH;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN,TIMES,SERIF;FONT-SIZE: 11PT;">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	As of December 31,
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	2015
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	, we had cash resources, consisting of cash and cash equivalents of $
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	1.4
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	million, a
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	de
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	crease
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	of $
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	1.7
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	million from the December 31,
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	2014
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	balance of $
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	3.1
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	&nbsp;million.&nbsp;&nbsp;The cash resources consist of Canadian and U.S. dollar denominated deposit accounts, money market funds and certificates of deposit.&nbsp;
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	We
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	generated
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	&nbsp;$
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	5.4
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	&nbsp;million f
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	rom
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	operati
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	o
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	n
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	s
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	during the year ended
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	December 31, 2015
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	. During the same period,

	we

</FONT>

	and we used $7.0

<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	million f
</FONT>

	o

	r financing activities.

<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;TEXT-JUSTIFY:INTER-IDEOGRAPH;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN,TIMES,SERIF;FONT-SIZE: 11PT;">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;TEXT-JUSTIFY:INTER-IDEOGRAPH;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN,TIMES,SERIF;FONT-SIZE: 11PT;">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	We have f
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	inanced
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	our
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	operations from inception
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	through the start of production, deliveries and product sales in 2013
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	primarily through the issuance of equity securities and debt instruments.
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	Our
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	first collections under those sales did not occur until January
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	2014
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	.
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	&nbsp;Since that time, we have continued production and sales which has financed our operations to date.&nbsp;&nbsp;Because of the irregular nature of our deliveries, we have fluctuations in our cash flow which we have addressed through negotiating with vendors to change delivery dates and exploring other options including additional financing.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT;BACKGROUND-COLOR: #FFFFFF;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;TEXT-JUSTIFY:INTER-IDEOGRAPH;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN,TIMES,SERIF;FONT-SIZE: 11PT;">

<DIV STYLE="WIDTH:100%">
<P STYLE="MARGIN:24PT 0PT 0PT;TEXT-ALIGN:CENTER;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN,TIMES,SERIF;FONT-SIZE: 11PT;">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	56
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">

<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">

<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-LEFT:10.2941176470588%;MARGIN-RIGHT:10.2941176470588%;">
<HR ALIGN="CENTER" STYLE='BACKGROUND-COLOR:#000000; BORDER-WIDTH:0; COLOR:#000000; HEIGHT:2PT; LINEHEIGHT:0; WIDTH:100%;'>

<P STYLE="PAGE-BREAK-AFTER:ALWAYS">
	&nbsp;
</P>
<A NAME="eolPage57"></A>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-LEFT:10.2941176470588%;MARGIN-RIGHT:10.2941176470588%;">
<DIV STYLE="WIDTH:100%">
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT 0PT 30PT;COLOR:#0563C1;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN,TIMES,SERIF;FONT-SIZE: 10PT;">
<A HREF="#URG-20151231X10K_HTM_TOC">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;COLOR:#0563C1;FONT-SIZE:10PT;">
	Table of Contents
</FONT>
</A>
</P>
</DIV>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-LEFT:10.2941176470588%;MARGIN-RIGHT:10.2941176470588%;">
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT;BACKGROUND-COLOR: #FFFFFF;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;TEXT-JUSTIFY:INTER-IDEOGRAPH;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN,TIMES,SERIF;FONT-SIZE: 11PT;">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;TEXT-JUSTIFY:INTER-IDEOGRAPH;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN,TIMES,SERIF;FONT-SIZE: 11PT;">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	On October 23, 2013, we closed a $34.0 million Sweetwater County, State of Wyoming, Taxable Industrial Development Revenue Bond financing program (&#x201C;State Bond Loan&#x201D;). Prior to closing the State Bond Loan, we had obtained interim financing from RMBAH which had been paid off from the proceeds of the State Bond Loan. On December 19, 2013, we redrew $5.0 million from the RMBAH loan facility. We subsequently renegotiated the loan amount to $6.5 million together with an additional line of credit of $3.5 million. The RMBAH loan facility calls for payments of interest at
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	8.5% plus the three month LIBOR rate recalculated at the start of each calendar quarter (approximately 8.76% in total) plus eight
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	equal quarterly principal payments which commenced June 30, 2014. The line of credit is due quarterly, but may be immediately redrawn.&nbsp;
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	On October 15, 2015, the loan was again amended to extend the maturity date of the $3.5 million line of credit to December 31, 2016 and spread the $3.5 million balance originally due March 31, 2016 over four quarterly payments commencing March 31, 2016 and concluding December 31, 2016, plus interest under the same terms as agreed to in September 2014. This was considered a modification for accounting purposes.&nbsp;
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	As of December 31, 2015, the outstanding balance on the loan was $0.83&nbsp;million while the balance on the line of credit was $3.5 million. The RMBAH loan facility is secured by all of the assets of Pathfinder.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT;BACKGROUND-COLOR: #FFFFFF;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;TEXT-JUSTIFY:INTER-IDEOGRAPH;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN,TIMES,SERIF;FONT-SIZE: 11PT;">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT;BACKGROUND-COLOR: #FFFFFF;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;TEXT-JUSTIFY:INTER-IDEOGRAPH;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN,TIMES,SERIF;FONT-SIZE: 11PT;">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	The State Bond Loan calls for payments of interest at a fixed rate of 5.75% per annum on a quarterly basis which commenced January 1, 2014. The principal is payable in 28 quarterly installments which commenced January 1, 2015 and continue through October 1, 2021. As of December 31, 2015, the outstanding balance on the loan was $28.9&nbsp;million.&nbsp;&nbsp;The State Bond Loan is secured by all of the assets at the Lost Creek Project.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;TEXT-JUSTIFY:INTER-IDEOGRAPH;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN,TIMES,SERIF;FONT-SIZE: 11PT;">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT;BACKGROUND-COLOR: #FFFFFF;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;TEXT-JUSTIFY:INTER-IDEOGRAPH;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN,TIMES,SERIF;FONT-SIZE: 11PT;">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	On August 19, 2014, we filed a universal shelf registration statement on Form S-3 in order that we may offer and sell, from time to time, in one or more offerings, at prices and terms to be determined, up to $100 million of our common shares, warrants to purchase our common shares, our senior and subordinated debt securities, and rights to purchase our common shares and/or our senior and subordinated debt securities.&nbsp; The registration statement became effective September 12, 2014
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	. The common shares offered in the February 2016 financing were sold
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	under the shelf registration statement.&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT;BACKGROUND-COLOR: #FFFFFF;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;TEXT-JUSTIFY:INTER-IDEOGRAPH;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN,TIMES,SERIF;FONT-SIZE: 11PT;">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;TEXT-JUSTIFY:INTER-IDEOGRAPH;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN,TIMES,SERIF;FONT-SIZE: 11PT;">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	Operating activities generated $5.4 million of cash resources during the year ended December 31, 2015 as compared to $1.9&nbsp;million in 2014. The change is due primarily to a decrease in the net loss for the year of $
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	7.9&nbsp;
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	million.
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	This is reduced by the income
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	tax recovery of $3.3
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	million.
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	In addition, we had reflected $2.5 million in revenue from the fulfillment of contracts in 2014 which had been assigned in 2013 which decreased the cash generated operations in 2014. Inventory decreased in value by $1.8 million in 2015, which freed additional cash from the sale of U
</FONT>
<SUB STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	3
</SUB>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	O
</FONT>
<SUB STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	8
</SUB>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	. The decrease in inventory value was driven by having lower average costs per pound in inventory. Actual inventory quantities increased during 2015 (see the Sales, Cost of Sales and Inventory table above). Offsetting the inventory value decrease was a reduction in depreciation and amortization of $1.1 million.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;TEXT-JUSTIFY:INTER-IDEOGRAPH;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN,TIMES,SERIF;FONT-SIZE: 11PT;">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;TEXT-JUSTIFY:INTER-IDEOGRAPH;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN,TIMES,SERIF;FONT-SIZE: 11PT;">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	During 2015, the Company invested $0.1 million in equipment. The Lost Creek
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	P
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	roject does not require significant capital expenditures and its sustaining capital expenditures have generally been less than $0.5 million per year.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;TEXT-JUSTIFY:INTER-IDEOGRAPH;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN,TIMES,SERIF;FONT-SIZE: 11PT;">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;TEXT-JUSTIFY:INTER-IDEOGRAPH;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN,TIMES,SERIF;FONT-SIZE: 11PT;">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	During 2015, the Company used $7.0 million for financing activities which was composed of $7.4 million in debt repayments and the collection of $0.4 million from the exercise of stock options.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT;TEXT-ALIGN:CENTER;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN,TIMES,SERIF;FONT-SIZE: 11PT;">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;TEXT-JUSTIFY:INTER-IDEOGRAPH;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN,TIMES,SERIF;FONT-SIZE: 11PT;">

</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;TEXT-JUSTIFY:INTER-IDEOGRAPH;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN,TIMES,SERIF;FONT-SIZE: 11PT;">

	&nbsp;
</FONT>

<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;TEXT-JUSTIFY:INTER-IDEOGRAPH;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN,TIMES,SERIF;FONT-SIZE: 11PT;">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	In February
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	2016, the Company raised $
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	5.9
</FONT>

</FONT>

	s partially due to the timing of
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
</FONT>

<DIV STYLE="WIDTH:100%">

<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-LEFT:10.2941176470588%;MARGIN-RIGHT:10.2941176470588%;">
<DIV STYLE="WIDTH:100%">
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT 0PT 30PT;COLOR:#0563C1;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN,TIMES,SERIF;FONT-SIZE: 10PT;">
<A HREF="#URG-20151231X10K_HTM_TOC">

	Table of Contents
</FONT>
</A>
</P>
</DIV>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="MARGIN-LEFT:10.2941176470588%;MARGIN-RIGHT:10.2941176470588%;">
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;TEXT-JUSTIFY:INTER-IDEOGRAPH;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN,TIMES,SERIF;FONT-SIZE: 11PT;">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	contracted deliveries and payment commitments
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	in 2016
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	. It is possible that additional
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	funding might be sought.
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	Although the Company has been successful in raising debt and equity financing in the past, there can be no guarantee that such funding will be available in the future
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;TEXT-JUSTIFY:INTER-IDEOGRAPH;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN,TIMES,SERIF;FONT-SIZE: 11PT;">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;TEXT-JUSTIFY:INTER-IDEOGRAPH;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN,TIMES,SERIF;FONT-SIZE: 11PT;">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	We expect that any major capital projects will be funded by operating cash flow, cash on hand
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	and
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	additional financing as required. If these cash sources are not sufficient, certain capital projects could be delayed, or alternatively we may need to pursue additional debt or equity financing and there is no assurance that such financing will be available at all or on terms acceptable to us. We have no immediate plans to issue additional securities or obtain additional funding other than that which may be required due to
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	the
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	uneven
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	nature of
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	cash flows
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	generated
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	from operations; however, we may issue additional debt or equity securities at any time.
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;TEXT-JUSTIFY:INTER-IDEOGRAPH;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN,TIMES,SERIF;FONT-SIZE: 11PT;">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN,TIMES,SERIF;FONT-SIZE: 11PT;">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;FONT-WEIGHT:BOLD;">
	Outlook for 2016
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;TEXT-JUSTIFY:INTER-IDEOGRAPH;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN,TIMES,SERIF;FONT-SIZE: 11PT;">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;TEXT-JUSTIFY:INTER-IDEOGRAPH;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN,TIMES,SERIF;FONT-SIZE: 11PT;">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	The average spot price per pound of U
</FONT>
<SUB STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	3
</SUB>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	O
</FONT>
<SUB STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	8
</SUB>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	, as reported by Ux Consulting Company, LLC and TradeTech, LLC, for
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	the week of February 22, 2016 was $33.50.&nbsp;&nbsp;As a result of
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	the continuing low spot price environment, we will once again maintain production at levels that will be consistent with our 2016 contractual sales obligations, which are 662,000 pounds at an average realizable price of $47.61 per pound.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;TEXT-JUSTIFY:INTER-IDEOGRAPH;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN,TIMES,SERIF;FONT-SIZE: 11PT;">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;TEXT-JUSTIFY:INTER-IDEOGRAPH;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN,TIMES,SERIF;FONT-SIZE: 11PT;">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	Our current production target for 2016 is to maintain an average production rate of approximately 60,000 pounds per month.&nbsp;&nbsp;Currently, we expect to produce (dry and drum) between 650,000 and 750,000 pounds of U
</FONT>
<SUB STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	3
</SUB>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	O
</FONT>
<SUB STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	8
</SUB>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	in 2016. Excess production will be used to build inventory, which may be utilized to complete discretionary spot sales transactions on an as needed
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	basis
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	. Our production rate may be adjusted based on operational refinements, and indicators in the market, including uranium spot and term pricing, and other factors.&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;TEXT-JUSTIFY:INTER-IDEOGRAPH;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN,TIMES,SERIF;FONT-SIZE: 11PT;">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;TEXT-JUSTIFY:INTER-IDEOGRAPH;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN,TIMES,SERIF;FONT-SIZE: 11PT;">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	In 2015, we sold 925,000 pounds of U
</FONT>
<SUB STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	3
</SUB>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	O
</FONT>
<SUB STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	8
</SUB>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	at an average price per pound of $45.20. Our gross margin per pound sold in 2015 was $13.53, or approximately 30%. On a cash basis (including ad valorem and severance taxes), our gross margin per pound sold for uranium produced in 2015 was $25.79, or approximately 57%. We expect similar margins in 2016 depending on the number and price of any spot sales made.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;TEXT-JUSTIFY:INTER-IDEOGRAPH;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN,TIMES,SERIF;FONT-SIZE: 11PT;">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;TEXT-JUSTIFY:INTER-IDEOGRAPH;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN,TIMES,SERIF;FONT-SIZE: 11PT;">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	In January 2016, production head grade continued to exceed technical projections averaging levels of
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	88.1
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	mg/l U
</FONT>
<SUB STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	3
</SUB>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	O
</FONT>
<SUB STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	8
</SUB>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	.&nbsp;&nbsp;During January, 60,643 pounds of U
</FONT>
<SUB STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	3
</SUB>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	O
</FONT>
<SUB STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	8
</SUB>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	were captured within the Lost Creek plant and 65,099 of those pounds were packaged in drums. To date, 75,000 pounds have been sold to customers in 2016.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;TEXT-JUSTIFY:INTER-IDEOGRAPH;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN,TIMES,SERIF;FONT-SIZE: 11PT;">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;TEXT-JUSTIFY:INTER-IDEOGRAPH;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN,TIMES,SERIF;FONT-SIZE: 11PT;">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	As at February 25, 2016, our unrestricted cash position was $6.8 million.&nbsp;&nbsp;Given our current cash resources, contracted sales positions and low cash costs per pound
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	, we do not anticipate the need for additional funding in 2016 unless it is advantageous to do so.
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT;TEXT-ALIGN:JUSTIFY;TEXT-JUSTIFY:INTER-IDEOGRAPH;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN,TIMES,SERIF;FONT-SIZE: 11PT;">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;">
	&nbsp;
</FONT>
</P>
<P STYLE="MARGIN:0PT;FONT-FAMILY:TIMES NEW ROMAN,TIMES,SERIF;FONT-SIZE: 11PT;">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY:INLINE;FONT-WEIGHT:BOLD;">
</FONT>
</P>
</DIV>
